content:
Posted: May 12, 2015
												I tried this game only because of the free weekend offered on Steam.  Its a Minecraft-ish, tower defence/attack, team FPS.  After playing a few games I discovered I really liked it so dished out the cash and bought it.  At the start of a game each team is closed off to prepare their defence of the cubes.  This involves building/destroying walls, setting traps and adding defences.  Once the "curtain" drops the game starts in earnest and you will have to defend the cube against the other team as well attack their cube.  You can do this by running in gung-ho, sneaking around the defences or tunnelling in from below.  Sometimes you get stuffed with a rubbish team and you are doomed from the start but to be honest I still enjoy the gameplay.  There is a variety of pre-set characters who are cartoonlike (in fact very Borderlands) but very well drawn with amusing one liners (which do start to get annoying and can give away your position).  So yes I will give this a positive review just because I have had my £10 worth out of the game.  There are more updates coming as well as a new character.i really really like this game, HOWEVER the queue times are not acceptable.  So I have changed this review.  I quite regularly queue for 5 or so minutes, finally get in a game and then the 10th person doesnt accept.  You then find yourself at the start of another queue starting at zero.  Also if you do get in a game, you may play a game where one cube is destroyed and you get an♥♥♥♥♥♥in your team who just wants to give up so continually spams Surrender.  If you fail to agree, he/she will then just type abuse and then eventually when you refuse to give up will then attack you and your defence and assist the enemy team.  Then to make it worse at the end of the match they vote you as a bad player just because you want to play the game.  It quite often takes 10 minutes to get in a game so I never want to surrender no matter how bad my team.  The down vote by the "♥♥♥♥♥♥quot; player then affects your queue times negatively.  It is such a shame that the queues are so bad and the fact that the kids get to vote against your willingness to play when it looks like you are losing.  Therefore I cant recommend it any longer.  A great game but ruined by really long queue times.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2016
												So,this is my first serious review on a game.  Pros  : Great F2P figure,every hero is obtainable with gold. Only skins require real money. -Great graphics,it looks really detailed. Well,seems here I ran out of ideas xD. Cons: Community(a part of) really rude persons,griefing destroying your traps , turrets, mortars etc. Some will even team kill you,but only with some specific weapons/traps for example Rolys Cannons or Sarges Rocket launcher,C4 and grenaded. Yes,I reccomend this game,its really addicting and worth giving it a shot.Okay so I feel like editing this a little bit and adding something describing every hero there is (cheapest to the most expensive) Sergeant Sarge Stone:Sarge is a really good close range - mid range with his rocket launcher and LMG. His c4 is more of a troll block dont get me wrong.... lets move on to Nigel Purdy Longshott: For new players,I reccomend building a sniper tower. It will help you out to take out enemies. His tiki head is good in tight places,as of you cant get easily out. Also beartraps work best with fake blocks. Anthony Tony Turreto:Tony is a good choice if you want to defend,his turrets are hardly destroyed and can even be fixed. His rivet gun,is essentialy a shotgun,nothing more. As that is his only weapon,it is not reccomended to go attacking with. next hero with a bigger price tag: Cogwheel:Cog is preety good for starters because he has high health and high DPS makes him a great choice for attacking since hes a tank. OP Juan Shinobi: Most people recognise him as op but hes okay,he isnt that game breaking. He is a mobilty hero so he is good for attacking. Doc Eliza Doolally: This crazed doctor is really powerful with its Toxic Ball launcher and Chemical grenades. Her hero block,the miasma mine is good also in tight places(just like Nigels Tiki Head) she is good for both defense and attack. Moving on to the next heroes. Lets start up with Dream Genie: I find her more of a troll class because her weapons arent that effective she is good in the attack because she can play tricks on the other teams defense and its a good way of infiltrating in the enemy base without getting hurt. Sweet Science: Well,havent played with him alot but i got him on the free rotation. he has some abilities just like Juan to teleport and stuff and he is good at point blank range with his gloves. The gravity well isnt that effective since u can destroy it before it catches you but maybe you get killed in the process. Astarella:Also, I havent played much with her but i can say she can be very annoying but very effective if played well. And last but not least the most expensive characters. Vander Graaf:Also,havent played much with him but i can say he is a considerate option in the defense,but i find him underpowered.. next is Kira Chan: Havent played at all with her,but she is good in both attack and defense. The SMGS are great at close range and the Kitty Launcher seems like its Sarges RPG but comes with a grenade detonation mode. Yuri The Yeti: He is good at camping at the base with a big pile of ice because its his ammo resource,the snowballs can be deadly if you have good aim and the snowthrower is preety much useless(does 2 damage lel) and moving on to Roly Poly Fat Fat: I like this one alot,she is great. Even though i cant aim for days with her cannons she is still alot of fun. The cannons have a one shot then if you want to deal heavy damage they can be fired at once(but have to wait 1 second before you can shoot them again) The Booster is good for getting supply drops first and if you cover yourself in the enemy base I reccomend to use the toxic fumes because the enemies will get caught in them and then die. And last but not least Kreepy The Clown: I think he is great at range with the gloves also at point blank range with the other use of the gloves. The banana is ok,you can use it as an obstacle for the enemy team or  as a grenade. His Special ability is preety useless,next to the avalanche. Im preety much done now explaining every hero,if you want further explanation just write down the comments. IF you actually are reading this now. Buh Bye! Oh and I have to add a con,sorry I had to :p,but there are some server problems out there,it just freezes.

Posted: October 3, 2015
												I was interested in this game for a long time after seeing some youtubers play it, but now that i can test it i realized the game is as bad as rumors said.If you don't live in North America, Europe or Australia your ping will be terrible.Seriously, EVEN THE TUTORIAL IS 200 PING. It would be a little bit forgivable if placing blocks was client side, but no, they aren't risking any possibility of exploits, everything, even the tutorial MUST be at their servers.Movement and aiming sucks, my default sensitivity was like 360 every 2 centimeters.Jumping is floaty and sprint jumping can go over a 5~ block gap, while jumping being floaty it still climbs a single block a time.EDIT:If i could make a private local server to play with friends, that would be enough for a positive review.Actually that would be enough for me to freaking BUY it, no need for the free to play and no microtransactions ruining the potential this game had.This is the minecraft objective class based gameplay i was looking for, but sucking a lot harder than minecraft's netcode.

Posted: June 19, 2015
												I have played this game for over 2000 hours now, so I might as well review it. There more negatives than positives, but you might as well try this game.GOOD:-No game is the same, which leads to many hours of new things.-Heroes are different, and most of them are actually fun to play.-Small playerbase, which has led to me meeting some cool people.BAD:-Small playerbase, which means you might have to wait a few minutes to find a game (only affects experienced players really).-1 developer, which means there are pretty much no updates.-Some heroes are unbalanced (such as SS and Vander), but it doesn't seem like they will be nerfed anytime soon.-Long queue times for experienced players.-High level play is boring as it consists of waiting until blockbuster (a boost) to end the game.-Game is filled with braindead, 10 year olds, so don't expect anything from your teammates.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												I'm gonna start this off saying I am not the "building games" kind of guy.I was probably bored as ♥♥♥♥ and stumbled upon this game, the trailers looked fun, so I tried it out for the heck of it.Straight to the point, this thing exceeded ALL my expectations, it's some sort of TF2 in which you can ♥♥♥♥ up your enemy's base, what's there not to like?Another thing that I liked a lot, is the necessary teamwork, being a lone wolf can get you ♥♥♥♥ed up.Here are the classes of the game:* O.P Juan Shinobi: Infiltrator class, get inside the enemy's base by climbing walls, sabotage their defenses and slice people with a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ sword.* Tony: Defensive class, builds turrets and has special building tools to assist allies.* "Doc": Offensive/Defensive class, throws some kind of toxic♥♥♥♥♥♥that makes people die.* Sarge: Has an LMG with a huge ammo capacity, a C4 charge, and frag grenades. great for destroying defenses.* Nigel: Has a long-range rifle (scopeless), tons of traps, and can ♥♥♥♥ you up from afar.* Cogwheel: A robot with a ton of health, a machinegun on his arm and a mortar.I'd advise you to give this game a shot, specially since you can play it for free if you get a beta code.http://blocknload.com/signupIt might look childish and all but I had tons of fun in this, met some nice people and I didn't even play that much, greatly recommended.

content:
Posted: November 29, 2016
												a sort of review i'd like a "mixed" button for.basically you've got another "it's like, a moba. but with blocks." idea, but this one's actually pretty unique, with cool, semi-original characters who all play differently, who excel with different block loadouts, etc.pros:-unique characters that are fairly balanced (vander graaf)-different perk loadouts (which you can buy with in-game currency acquired through playing) that can boost your areas of expertise-brains heroes are pretty cool-"build phase" before a round in which you can build up your base before the 4 enemy skill-type heroes all flank through the same narrow path at the same time-3 different classes of heroes: brawn, brains, and skill-there are like, 5 songs on the soundtrack, but those are pretty good, i guess. they're also impossible to find on youtubecons:-this community holy♥♥♥♥♥♥br>-almost every update is balancing changes that didn't need to happen or like 1-2 new skins and then it's complete silence and no support for a month-90% of your matches 1-3 people will instantly lock into a hero that they want to play, usually a skill-type one (sniper hero, flank-based ninja hero, etc) and will barely communicate at all, usually if they do it's in a foreign language despite being in your proper regional server (no racism intended but i'd like to not see russian text every single game in the us server)-there are only 4 brains (support) heroes, and half the tools they need to properly build a base are from other classes. in addition, 2 of the brains are offense-oriented, meaning if you want to/have to defend you'll be playing the same heroes, over and over.-the in-game currency grind takes way too long. most of the "fun" heroes (or just simply ones used in the meta more often) take around 15-ish hours of grinding money to get. there are daily missions+rewards and normal achievements that can boost your cash intake, however.-25+ minute queues, only like 10 people in the queue-the competitive league is beyond dead and is only active during some parts of the day and week, so most of the time any remaining pro players that have like 800+ hours will jump in and pubstomp regularly, hope they're on your team.-most of the time, even if you volunteer yourself to go brains defender, your team will start wrecking the base and not communicating with you at all.-some characters are horribly imbalanced, and with certain perk loadouts have no weaknesses (ie: the 540 hp cogwheel)-hidden blocks blend into the normal ground (actually they look identical to the nearby blocks) and evaporate when you walk on them, which allows people to send you through the map or into a trap that garuntees instant death. whenever i die to these i don't think "whoa, i should've been paying more attention" i think "how the ♥♥♥♥"-first few matches in which you're thrust into a game with only 3 available heroes (which are all situational) and are most likely thrown against a 200+ hour person-all in all, the game has lots of flaws, and most of them are with the community (including devs), and i'm nominating it the custom category "game ruined by community".

content:
Posted: April 29, 2015
												If you have played ace of spades or other similar games that introduces voxel base building and first person shooter but was disappointed, then you might avoid it with this game, Block N Load. BnL is trying to have a fine balance between letting a player enjoy base building such as placing blocks, traps, turrets and other gadgets around within a certain time limit, before all hell breaks loose and the big wall is removed. At the same time it is allowing first person shooter fans to have fun just shooting anything and everything, blocks, traps, turrets, players and so on. Whether you want to focus on building defense, traps and buildings using blocks then you can contribute that way. If you want to go in gunning, then you can do that. If you want to stay behind and snipe, you can do that too. Maybe you want to sneak around and climb up the walls, you can do that too. Perhaps you want to mix it all up, you can do that too. All in all, it offers a great variety and strategy when playing. If you don't care much for team play you can still have fun just playing lone wolf, gathering resources by breaking bricks and using them to put out lots of firepower in turrets or just traps, even intel such as radar.If you are terrible at FPS but always wanted to have fun playing an FPS this is your chance to still be a team player, contribute and even end up first in your team...even if you lost the match. As you rack up points also by destroying bricks and placements while building new things. So killing alone might not be sufficient anymore.So if you enjoy building, placing out things, sneaking, sniping, gunning, running, climbing, jumping, digging, healing, being random, trying to be creative or figure out new ways to combine the different classes you all play as a team who have access to different equipment, to create a new way to attack, defend or just be crazy creative while bombs and gunshot is flying around...then so be it. Do that...It's a great game. Play it...Classes - Standard equipment + unique equipment for the class you choose. Level them up, get bonus and more powerful buffs...Come on, go on....I know you want to play it...

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 4, 2015
												It's great. You should buy it if you enjoy:- a tactical shooter in which mindless run&gun is punished by an increasing respawn timer and various devious traps that the enemy team builds- coordinating with friends to pull off crazy stunts- shooters where you don't die instantly but instead have the ability to balance for screw-ups by tactics and coordination You shouldn't buy it if:- You like to run and gun and think that teamwork is for sissies- You feel like a 40 second respawn timer after 40 minutes of match is too long (the respawn gets longer the longer the game goes on. To prevent eternal games)- You value solo-play. The game is best when you work together with your team mates. This goes all the way down to your character class selection. The team can't be all Ninjas, so you should be prepared to pick something useful instead. In general this game is great fun. The graphics are vibrant, the gameplay is very polished and overall balanced. The game rewards playing smart and punishes mindless stupidity. It is prone to griefing and the team suffering due to incompetent members, but as of right now I played 13 hours and have not encountered more than one or two such unfortunate events.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2015
												This is my 1st review of any game i have ever put up on steam but i feel compelled to give a review here.I got this game from a friend and i loved it ever since. Its a moba type game like smite and league but more like smite with it being 3D, it has some building elements inspired from minecraft and fast paced fps action. Defend your base with 4 other people in a 5v5 match. I'v had tons of fun playing this game and i only been playing one class.Pros:  Fast paced action           Solid game mechanics(Except for the accidental jumping off ledges and the side of the map dying.)          Class's are unique no 2 class feel the same.          Maps are beautiful and colorful          The class level system is really cool and fun gives you mastery over a certain class.           Team based game.Cons:  Solid game mechanics(Except for the accidental jumping off ledges and the side of the map dying.)           Some class feel over power and very stale to play vs.(Example is Eliza has DoT AoE that does not require much aim             at all.)           The game client could be better           There is only 6 class.s I want there to be more class's.           People can pick the same character in the same game so we basicly could have 10 ninja's all in one game. I dont like this very much because its stale and not very fun i like diversity.            Probably will get boring without more content.Over all i like this game very very much. I would love for a mod or another version of this game came out like a MMORPG with the class's they have and the skill mechanics. But thats just my idea.Do i recommend this game. Well lets see i'm going to go out and buy the $20 bundle and get 2 keys so i can play with more friends. I hope you guys like this as much as i do.

Posted: June 12, 2015
												I would like to say that this game is extremely fun, but I dunno if I should say if it is STILL fun.I liked it when lava and water can get you killed, so now if ur on a water map, you literally have to worry about people getting in from the side of the maps or such.And not only that, but the range of the rocket is outragously long, where the player could literally just place down a ammo block and constantly shoot until the cube explodes.Another thing that seemed to change is that the ninja is somehow more irritating, I was fine with the ninja disappearing and leaving a bomb, but also healing and replenishing ammo??? It is bad enough if you don't have radars surrounding practically your entire base or the ninja could hide the shrine ANYWHERE. I know the shrine is the ninja's major ability but add that in with the exploding healing smoke bomb....kinda turns the ninja a bit OPMedic seems good, xcept it isn't fun that she has quite a long range with her gernades.Science actually seems fine.Asterella seems fine also.Sarge is good.Tony is good.Nigel is good also (thank god there isn't a scope lol)Cog is also good.So far this game was extremely fun when it did the free weekend before it offically got a price. But it somehow seemed to patch a bit and might of accidently made a character or 2 a bit OP without realizing it.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 4, 2015
												This game really does feel like a cross between Team Fortress 2 and Minecraft. It has the best of both worlds: class-based FPS action, destructible/buildable environments, great physics, and a strong tactical feel.The whole game feels very polished, and at no point did I feel it was pay-to-win. All of the cash shop stuff is cosmetic only, which at this point in the games industry's development, I'm totally OK with.Well worth the money I spent. Great fun at a cheap price, and it's got loads of replayability.The only thing I don't like is that some elements of the UI are less polished, like voicechat. Voicechat works well, but it's not well documented and it's hard to tell who's speaking at any given time.

number of helpful: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12, 2016
												This game is extremely fun and addicting. This is a small mix of League of Legends + Minecraft + TF2, with it's own unique mechanics. There is a small bit of a learning curve, but you can learn it very fast. Pros-Fun and addicting-Not pay2winYou pay for skins, you can pay for heroes, but still get them for free. Perks are also buyable, but only with the free currency.-A ton of mapsOf course, some are better than others.-Each game is differentYou build and fortify your base, so each game will be different.-Not region lockedIf your friend is from EU and you're from NA you guys can still queue together, unlike a fair amount of games.Cons-High queue timesDuring weekends and afternoon weekdays the queue times are short. But other than that they can be a bit long, and you will run into the same people a lot. They are also a lot longer for players just starting out so you don't run into people who stomp you.-UnbalancedThe game is a bit unbalanced for sure.-RanksYour rank can only go up, not down. This removes the stress from the game, but rank is less skill and more grind. They are fixing this soon (maybe) with a new ranked mode.Overall, I for sure recommend this game. It is a ton of fun

content:
Posted: August 10, 2015
												Omg dis best game ever, look at my playtime etc. etc.On a more serious note, the game involves a steep learning curve and is difficult to master. The 'Build' is just as important as the 'Load', meaning you don't have to be good at aiming to be decent at this game. The game gets extremely tactical, especially when the teams are balanced. That's the main issue though. The lack of players is really this game's greatest downfall. This isn't much of a problem for new players in their first 50 hours, but when your MMR (Match Making Rank) reaches a certain point, the queues start to last longer than the games you get lol. Yes this is probably because the game fails to put high ranking players against eachother since only 2 or 3 are online during most of the week, but a 10 minute queue for a 5-10 minute game gets pretty repetitive after a while.Anyways, the game is really fun and you should definitely try it. After all, it is free to play, you can't really complain lol

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												9/10A really fun game. I honestly cannot remember the last time I had so much fun playing a shooter. Graphics:The graphics look much more like TF2 than Minecraft, but are unique to themselves. Though there are blocks, many of them are not cubes. There are all shapes and sizes.  It looks sleek and modern, not retro at all. There are also nice shadow and lighting effects. The style works for the type of game it is. In the heat of battles, blocks fly everywhere from explosions going off all around you, which adds to the experience drasticly.Gameplay:First and foremost is the unique ability to break or build anything. It adds a layer of strategy not found in most shooters. Defenses do not have to be complicated to be effective, though complicated desings can work if applied correctly. It takes a lot of time to develop good strategies for building on each map.Once the match begins, after the build stage, you can do just about anything. Digging under a base is as viable as building over one. As others have said, unlike in Minecraft, there is gravity, so you will not be able to build floating bridges. Each character feels really unique, and you really need one from each of the 3 categories to be successful (usually).  The weapons in this game are SOOO satisfying. A combination of good sound effects and visual effects makes each one pop, and landing a shot, no matter the weapon, always feels good. Each character also has a special ability, which, for most characters, offers support for yourself and all surrounding teamates.Teamwork is key in this game. You need to use text or voice chat to tell eachother what you are doing, and make sure to plan attacks ahead of time. Running in wildly is not an option in this game, even for the tank class Cog.Right now there is only one gamemode: Destroy the Base, but the developers are going to have more ready for launch in less than a month. I am hoping for a Payload type mode, where players place the tracks for the bomb train to follow.Despite just one gamemode, I have yet to become bored, thanks to well designed maps that offer good variety. Player map creation is another planned feature to be looking forward to.Overall I would HIGHLY recommend this game. It has something for everybody, even those who don't usually like shooters. I hope that this game will continue to expand and grow a healthy community once it is released in a few weeks!

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
Refreshing gameAfter playing this game for hours, testing everything and being on the multiples forums (steam, reddit) I believe I can make a comprehensive review of this awesome game.There's a DEMO available, that allow you to play ONLY a few characters available. You can play with every other users, on every maps. Try it before you buy it ! ;) Also a pack (5 players) is available if you have any friends that are willing to play with you. Pros (+)  Incredible freedom with blocks, it feels good to model the battlefield ! You can dig holes to make traps, create bridge, sneak around below thanks to tunnels, create bunkers. This is great to use your creativity to defend and attack ! The devs are quite present (especially on reddit), and listen to the complaints as well as the questions of the player. (You can find a discussion I had with them on reddit, search for ArthurCP). This feels great to be able to contact people from within ! The characters available are quite different and each bring something powerful and different with them ! From the turret makers to the very mobile ninja, and also a robot making mortars. You're sure to find a character suited to you !  Devs plan to add more characters, more blocks for MORE FUN!  Cons (-)  Lack of players sometimes but not a big issue in my opinion, didn't really felt the lack of players. You might have to wait a few minutes to get into a game. Jagex (the company that own the game) is making a lot of marketing to help onto that. Jagex do not have a great reputation in the gaming world as they ♥♥♥♥ed up some games. But seems like Block N Load is a completely different story (AT THE MOMENT, 26/06/2015). Some issues with the matchmaking, that allow team of multiple experimented players against casual/new players. This lead to a very bad first view of the game for the new players.Even if there's negative points, I highly recommend this game as it's skill rewarding (creativity, time to learn some "construction" such as bunkers, etc.) and I find the atmosphere really enjoyable !

Posted: December 5, 2016
												my god. This game has it all. A minecraft style MOBA with beautiful graphics and very competitive/ decent concepts. How do you ♥♥♥♥ THAT UP!?!?!? Well Ironically it isn't the game. It's actually the communtiy. Casual mode is nowhere near bearable when the only people you play with are idiots who only want to go on the offensive and suck badly at it. Not to mention that everyone just so happens to want to play the same character as you or someone else. So your chances of winning are hardly any. Mainly because there's no team comp nor is there great matchmaking. The sad part is how great this game is if you actually had a good team. I can't reccomend this game to anyone....yet. It's too early in the stages to be considered popular (Especially since PvP is dead most of the time) that and there's not nearly enough heros to choose from to make diveristy amongst the teens. But hey if you wanna  survive through the harsh grind of leveling 3 characters you're good with to lvl 15 and try ranked, it's in beta. Nothing to lose except your precious time that you'll never get back.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												Played this for a couple hours now and I must say, I've been looking for a game like this.The game looks very simple but it involves a good amount of skill and teamwork to defeat your opponents.I think the game also has quite some replay value, since every match you play is different. There's different ways of trying to win a match. Also finding the perfect way to defend your base will probably be a long road. The private matches are fun party games to do when you're with a bunch of friends and looking for things to play together.The hero-system reminds me of League of Legends, you can choose from a bunch of heroes that all have different abilities. As far as I assume they will be adding more heroes over time(?)Overall I think this game is good fun!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 12, 2015
												Block N Load is something new and fresh to the game market. With it's catchy music, unique art style and competitive multiplayer, this game brings a lot of fun and friends to your PC. Each character you choose has a totally different fighting style and Silhouette, they each have a role to play on this team based multiplayer. Pick the wrong character setup and you may not do to well so choose wisely. You are a 5 man team facing another 5 man team with your own side of the map. Once the match begins you have a few minuites to prep your base by setting up traps, reinforcing things or building anything you can think of that may help win the game. During this time you cannot see or go to the other teams base, once the timer hits zero each team is free to attack. You may still build after the timer but you will have non friendlys attacking you at any time. The way to win is to attack they enemies cube, a small square genereator looking cube. Depending on the map chosen in the beginning by voting, you may have up to 3 cubes to destroy.  Once one of the two teams destroys all of the cubes it is game over where you can look at your stats before heading back to start a new mach. I fell in love with Block N Load. It's refreshing to see something new on the market with a great community including friends from all over the world. Everyone is there to help you because they need you in order to win. The devs are very good at responding to any questions, concearns or just to chat occasionally. I find myself not wanting to stop playing even when I need to. Every game I find myself on the edge of my seat as I get into fast paced battles with other players seeing who can outsmart our destroy the other.  Each play is different and the game can change and flip at any moment, you will find yourself stuck fighting and defending untill one team breaks through enemy lines taking you and your cube down or vise versa. That is what makes me love this game, that is why I reccomend this game. No other game can you laugh, fight, and sometimes cry all in one match.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												Block N' Load was an amazing Beta when I played it. The only problems I had with the game, wasn't really the game itself:Graphics are good, game-play is one-of-a-kind, and it is truly fun to play.My issues lied within the community; I adore a good game, but if it's going to be centered around multiplayer, community is important. The Beta had only a few players who were willing to buy it, and the ones who probably got a code generator were hackers, and without any V.A.C. system or report features, this game was horrible to play and have a good time.Now, fully fledged with constantly updated and bursting new content all the time, the community is much better. I know a lot of people may think that Free-to-Play means lots of noob-ish players, but at least their better than too few players at all, or hackers! And on top of that, anyone who DID buy the Beta, retains some of the previously available (but now unlockables) from the getgo.As far as game-play goes, everything is pretty balanced an fair to play, it runs smooth, looks nice, controls are a bit clunky (who cares, you can reconfigure them!), but best of all: IT'S A GAME THAT IS A FREE TO PLAY AND DOESN'T FOCUS ON MICRO-TRANSACTIONS! Yeah, they have them, but they really won't get you anything that gives any sort of advantage over another player. Their also not so in-your-face about them either, almost like a thing you can do but you have no reason to do it.All in all,8.6/10-CrazyContraption @ R&S Corp.

												Block N' Load was an amazing Beta when I played it. The only problems I had with the game, wasn't really the game itself:Graphics are good, game-play is one-of-a-kind, and it is truly fun to play.My issues lied within the community; I adore a good game, but if it's going to be centered around multiplayer, community is important. The Beta had only a few players who were willing to buy it, and the ones who probably got a code generator were hackers, and without any V.A.C. system or report features, this game was horrible to play and have a good time.Now, fully fledged with constantly updated and bursting new content all the time, the community is much better. I know a lot of people may think that Free-to-Play means lots of noob-ish players, but at least their better than too few players at all, or hackers! And on top of that, anyone who DID buy the Beta, retains some of the previously available (but now unlockables) from the getgo.As far as game-play goes, everything is pretty balanced an fair to play, it runs smooth, looks nice, controls are a bit clunky (who cares, you can reconfigure them!), but best of all: IT'S A GAME THAT IS A FREE TO PLAY AND DOESN'T FOCUS ON MICRO-TRANSACTIONS! Yeah, they have them, but they really won't get you anything that gives any sort of advantage over another player. Their also not so in-your-face about them either, almost like a thing you can do but you have no reason to do it.All in all,8.6/10-CrazyContraption @ R&S Corp.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												And the title for my most surprisingly fun game of the year goes to... Block N Load!!I saw that this game was now free to play on steam after many months of ridicule towards both the game itself and it's unappealing £15 price tag and so, given my laptops inability to render any graphics more advanced than that of minecraft, I decided to give it a go. And boy was I wrong to mock it. This game takes the fun strategic multiplayer of csgo, gives it a dash of TF2 and smothers it in a minecraft art style and building system, creating a rather odd frankenstein's monster which actually plays surprisingly well.The main gamemode in Block N Load is a 'defend the objective' mission in which you must build defences around one or more cubes to prevent the enemy team doing melee damage to it, and attacking the enemies cube until either objective loses all of it's health and explodes. Simple enough. But through playing the game, I discovered it's extremely strategic and team based undertones which sets Block N Load apart from other generic shooters. For example, the multiple classes of characters, that can be unlocked through either in game cash or real money, offer a unique play style for either attacking the enemy or defending your own cube. They all feature different items and blocks to place to both remain balanced and also fill in their specific role.You may have noticed that I mentioned the purchase of characters through real money. Although I, along with many people on the internet, hate microtransactions this game manages to implement them in a way that doesn't really give people who pay a large advantage. They do this by making the heroes relatively easy to unlock by earning cash through playing the game and also having skins for the heroes that can be purchased that offer NO ingame advantages.the graphics for this game, with some special blocks and the heroes as an exception, are very similar to that of minecraft making for an interesting looking game that actually performs well on any PC. I personally use a HP pavillion G6 2000 series laptop and the game constantly runs at 30fps on low settings, not impressive for many but it is an achievement for my little piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥TL;DRPros:-Fun Gameplay-Well optimised-FREECons:-Can spend real money to unlock characters-not AAA graphics (just adding this to try and seem more fair, I understand that they weren't aiming for that)Would recommend any day

content:
Posted: April 18
												Take a constantly-rotting community bowl, add in a cup of Team Fortress 2, 3 tablespoons of Minecraft and stir them until the mixture looks pleasant.Take a matchmaker and chop it in an as unbalanced manner as possible, then add it to the previously-made composition.Next, grab a fresh tutorial and peel it well, in fact, remove the flesh until you get close to the seed and drop it in.Put it in the oven for 15 minutes or more, depending on your internet speed. The finished product should be a FUN game, even FUNNIER played with friends, but LESS FUN after reaching level 10 or so (where you begin to get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥by the pros and matches last up to an hour), with a broken matchmaking that will take 1 to 5 minutes to get into a game and even then you'll be encountering 2 vs 6 situations (at worst), with some cool starter heroes and some cooler, more powerful ones, that cost a fortune and will require over 16 hours of not premium gameplay, that encourages players to rush into the game with 0 knowledge of what to do through a thin tutorial and the option to skip that tutorial for bonus cash (seriously), where nobody has any idea what are they doing except for wrecking everything in their way (explosions, yaaay).BUT, overall, I would still recommend it. Serve it with a LOT of PATIENCE and care (because it can be addictive).

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												Edit: Oh bummer, seems the beta key I got that gave me access to the beta for free is no longer valid, looks like I have to shell 15 dollars out to keep playing. Perhaps I can argue that I bought Ace of spades and deserve to get this for free? D:Just so you guys know, I was one of the people who was horribly let down by Jagex's fantastic butchering of Ace Of Spades which left me unsatisfied and . So When I first heard of this game, I was FURIOUS. How dare Jagex make another game using the same font layout for the title using the same concept?So I started playing it recently, and I'm amazed with how far they've come and how much they've improved. With no dedicated fanbase of origin like Ace Of Spades, they took some neat creative freedom, making a MOBA-styled shooter with building integrated into the gameplay. Gameplay can have a lot of variety, as one can shift between offense and defense pretty quickly! using the same character! Destructive items are limited by the fact that they cost a lot of "blocks" to build and take awhile to do so, discouraging griefers from just spamming bombs as they would have to gather the resources  to break blocks by digging a ton first.Only nitpick I have right now is the time it takes to find a match, but that's presumably due to the game being in beta and weekend-long windows that the devs have been leaving for public testing. It's also a bit difficult to use the weapons in combat as there are no bots one can train against to help track moving targets, so it's reccomended you bring your 1337 tracking skillz to this game from other games.Overall, a very enjoyable and chaotic game!

												If you're thinking about buying the pre-release, I highly recommend it. Not only do you get the game but some AMAZING skins and ace of spades. Jagex may have made some mistakes in the past but they're really bringing it back with BnL. This game gets tweaked  and updated so often and they are always adding new things, like how  recently they added 3 new characters. Also, there are loads of things to come such as new maps, characters, and even gamemodes!What I like about BnL is that you can play really casually or you can go hardcore if you want. Also, it's not violent compared to other FPS' and has a lot of variety. Like their motto says, no game is the same, and this  is completely true. BnL is a like a mix of TF2  and minecraft. What more could you  want  from a game?

content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												For £10 it's a very top game for it's money, but because it costs £22... well you know too exspensive.Pro's-Awesome concept and idea and works very well in practise-Looks very beatiful-Block physics are very very cool-Classes are pretty original by now but there abilites go well witht he classes and are cool ideas and look good-GUI is actually really decent-Soundtrack is also very good-Effects are very artistic and look nice in there cartoon fashionCons-Plays slow and badly paced most of the time-Movement is really horrible, as said on another review it's like sticky custard. You can jump and feel the momentum but one block will stop that moment making the game feel sluggish and damn bad. (MAJOR FLAW FOR ME)-Some unbalanced classes (Nail shotgun uselessly weak vs mostly all other hero weapons)-Map does not get destroyed as much as i'd like.Good/ish things-Maps are bland looking but that works well for building on.-Art style feel everso slightly all over the palce. (Super cool looking cartoony effects, with a blocky works, and with decently high detailed characters feels like an odd mix of content)I recomend for £10-£15 not any higher i'm sorry even with all the pro's it just feels slow and slugish.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
												Note: Beta key user from website, then bought full game.To get your free beta key visit: [https://www.blocknload.com/signup/]This game is NOT a pay to win (so far) the only thing paying money gets you is skins. There is a forum on steam by the VP / Studio Head going over some of these concerns: [http://steamcommunity.com/app/299360/discussions/0/626329820802521208/] Buying the full game after owning the beta key will presents you with some orange warning text when purchasing, ignore this, this is because the version of the game you recieve from paying is the same as the beta key version:[https://steamcommunity.com/app/299360/discussions/0/626329820654746292/?l=finnish]   (scroll down a bit)Overall i highly recomend this game, it is similiar to the combat and overall design and feel of TF2 with its class based multiplayer and team play aspects. i have seen many people complain about greifers and trolls but i have yet to encounter anyone ingame who has purpousley gone out of their way to achieve this. Really love this game as it combines aspects of minecraft, TF2 and isnt just a 'brute force' game where you can just rush the enemy team; class balancing is generally good but it really depends upon team composition and experience with that class.And for the low low price of £15 you get the full game on release, a skin pack and woah....A FREE ACE OF SPADES BATTLE BUILDER....*just ♥♥♥♥emed*TL;DR Great game, shows promise, not p2w, unnecessary Jagex hate, overall 8/10 with potential.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2015
												THIS GAME IS NOT ACE OF SPADES!People have been  mad at jagex for the things they have done in the past, such as ace of spades, but Block n Load isnt that. Unlike ace of spades, which felt like a crash grab, this game feels like they put their hearts into it, its oozing with character, everything is so colourful and bright. Each class has their own purpose with diffrent blocks and abilities and stats, the classes are also brilliantly desighned, theres ninjas, robots, rambos, crazy scientists, and a sterotype italian. They all have skins which are quite wacky and make you stand out. They are all wellbalanced (maybe the ninja is a bit strong.) The game play is like a mix of Awesomenauts(A MOBA) and Minecraft,(First person builder) The objective is to destroy the enemies core, and defend yours, you have to build defenses, plant traps and modify the terrrarain so you get full advantage of it, you have to communicate though with whose defending and attacking or it will be a short round. Only problems ive had with this game is the friendly fire and the trolls, if you have a jerk team mate he can plant tnt onto your core and ruin everyonelses day, if you dont defuse it in time, Theres no punishment for being afk aswell, and its hard finding an oceanic server, luckily N American servers work fine.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 7, 2016
												Hello and I'm writing this review because why not I have 50 hours on this game and feel like I'm eligible to review it.What I like about Block N Load:Block N Load I feel is a great game for being free. It is a really fun game to play with friends super easy to pick up and has a nice learning curve that can let you get dozens of hours of fun with friends. The game is great to play with friends who have cruddy connection (Danish friend plays with me on NA servers and gets like 150 ping doesn't really have much lag issues).The community isn't bad(probably because most of the kids that play don't know that there is voice chat)It is most definitely not pay to play because the only stuff you can buy are heroes, and you can get enough in game money to buy everything if you play around 100 hours. The only few things I would like to see changed is: 1. More content(I know this will come with time)2. During build time I would like there to be a middle ground where you can fight the enemy over an objective/buff that you can keep fighting over throughout the game (I play Op "juan" and some maps I don't do much during building phase).

Posted: May 13, 2015
												This game is absolutely fantastic. As someone with 1000+ hours in TF2, it feels like a very similar style of shooter. However, this game has an absolutely incredible level of depth and strategy that TF2 lacks. Conversely, however, the point-and-click aiming skill of many shooters is less prevalent in this game, though still very much present. All around, it is a fantastic game by one of my favorite developers, and it is well worth the price.

												9/10The game is what is says... a unique fpsbut first off... this is not minecraft...while it might look simular, you can only place 7 blocks (6 that you can choose, and 1 based on the class you chose out of 5 classes), and their main purpose is movement, attacking, or defending. you are not building just for the sake of it...if you whant to compare it to a game, you would have to choose tf2 (with simular class, gameplay and weapons system), or battlefield 4 (with is's destructable enviroment).while it is a little repeditive, the game requires teamwork and strategy that makes it compelling to win.there is a little lag at times, but it is currentley still in beta so this is expected.~ajcres

content:
Posted: October 2, 2015
												I love this game. This game is gave me so much entertainment, and everything about it was pretty refreshing. Honestly the few hours I played of it with my friend was some of the most fun I've had in a while, and we were excited to start playing with otu third friend who had started downloading it after we realised how fun this game was. And then it all fell apart.Turns out you can only make a "squad" of yourself and one other friendfor matchmaking. For some reason, it's you're not able to join up with more than that one friend and go play some games online. You can create custom games, but they take ages to fill up, and it's no where near as convenient as normal mathcmaking is. I still don't understand the decision for this really, I guess it's something to do with skill control, and making sure than a bunch of randomers don't get pitted against some tried and tested group of people, but stil.... this decision is stupid, and it means I gotta pick a friend each time I wanna play with some and just have some fun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												I was a beta tester for Block N Load, so I've been playing it since the very beggining, and to be honest, there was nothing wrong with the pay-to-play version. It feels like Jagex realy took down the game's quality in an attempt to make this game more widely available. I mean, we used to have all heros and the only problem I can think of is a semi-long que time, not to mention the fact that most people had to pay $30 for this, and are only compensated with a $10 premium package. But with the addition of having to buy heros, perks, and other things, it seems that this once great game is going to freemium purgitory. However, the game is very innovative and fun, especialy if you're a fan of minecraft or TF2. overall, I would give this game a 7.8/10 for the new updates. Please Jagex, if your reading this, make some sort of change for everyone who is very dissapointed, who bought the game and are now disgraced by the fact that they have to share a que with unskilled free-to-play players who only make the game that much more frustrating. I would recomend something like a server for premium members, or even better, a remake of the origional.

Posted: October 17, 2015
												its not best but its good at first was very enjoyable but after few  hours it becaome kinda repeating, in other words its not deep enough to bestGOOD:- really nice looking- tutorial is really good at explaining- its not pay2win- round timing can be fast (depending on team)- new/all "heroes" can be bought with ingame money- its really challengingOver all you can get a lot in game by just investing time in itBAD:- its not deep at all, you cant buy new/other weapons for your "heroes" its basicly one/two weapons you get and thats it (not including things like mines and turrets)- you need to invest way to much time to get new "hero", you get about 2k-3k (3k+) in game money per day- building blocks/turrets/mines is way unenjoyable, just waiting still on one play to build one thing for 2-10 sec its realy unenjoyable for meThere is not really much bad in this gameMY OPINION:- add more different weapons- redo building mechanics in this game- add menu tutorial explaining what is where (i noticed you can buy perks after 5h of playing)- add more options (like toggle mouse aim)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 19, 2015
												This game. Just playing it for a few hours, and I'm HOOKED!Characters are an interesting bunch, each of them with their own abilities and special buildings. Also, some voice lines are really funny. Sure, some characters take time to learn, but the game is always about team effort and composition.The stages are enjoyable, comprising of small ones with 1 cube to big ones with 3. A lot of them also have good spots for hiding e.g. respawn pads in enemy territoryWhen it comes to matches, they always differ from one another; for example, I could end up with a bad team in one match, losing really badly, and suddenly have a skillful one in another, winning with a big margin.I'd say, this is one of the most unique FPS games I've seen. And since it also became free-to-play, there really is no restriction on playerbase. Friendly hint: go through the tutorials before playing to get familiar with the mechanics

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												This is a very interesting game. It takes MOBA style objectives in order to win, FPS style shooting, Minecraft style building all bundled together into one game. When first entering a game you have 5 mins to build with blocks. The goal of the game is to Protect your "cores" while attacking the enemy's. Within these 5 minutes you have to build fortifactions, and maybe a setup to build into No man's land. When this time is up the barrier that blocks you disappears and you attack. Every character is uniquely designed weapons wise. The medic has a gun that arcs balls, a robot with a chaingun, a soldier with a m60, a hunter with a sniper (scopeless), a ninja with shurikans, and an engineer with a shotgun. While these characters are interesting I do have to admit certain guns are directly more powerful than others. The sniper rifle can be used in CQB and is generally better than the Medic's "bubble gun". In certain times it can even trump the shotgun that can only be used in close quarters. While the chaingun does do fast damage. With that said maybe these classes aren't right for me since I use cogwheel the robot tank mostly. With all that said, this game plays well and is a lot of fun.  However I came along with some issues.Number 1: The game can be VERY slow. As in the two teams just defend and no  one tries to make a move. I've been in many hour + games.While this is mostly the player's fault, it can be resolved with a timer ticking down or some sort of penalty.Number 2: If you get stuck with a new player, you lost. The game has a video explaining what to do, and it doesn't explain well. A hands on tutorial would be best to fix thisNumber 3: If one person leaves, you are at a serious disadvantage and have a way greater chance at losing the game. Like issue number 1, this is more player's error, but can be fixed with a severe penalty. Leaving a game because you died once is no reason to make your team lose.Numbner 3.5: There are as many AFKers as people that leave too. Once again, have a penalty for AFKing, or make it easy to report these playersNumber 4: This game is no way worth the price it's being asked. It's a fun game, but not a $30 fun game. Making this free to play with skin sales or making it atleast $15 cheaper would make it worth it. At least what I'm shown isn't worth $30Currently playing the beta, I'm going to recommend this game as it is tons of fun as a free game and I completely respect that it's a game in beta. However if these issues aren't addressed, I can't recommend it. With all that said the biggest issue is the pricing point + the ingame marketplace where you must pay for skins. With that said, this game can be very interesting with time to come.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												I've put more than a little time into this game, and I have to say, the developers listen to the fans. The community routinely bounces ideas off of them, and they very often implement their suggestions. If someone's OP, they fix it.Additionally, each character has a serious amount of depth to them. Personally it's taken me dozens of games to get competent with a single character, and even then you still learn something new every game. Would definitely reccomend in its current state as a fast tactical shooter best enjoyed with friends.8.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2015
												Best FPS!!! About This GameBETA REGION SERVERS: USA / EUROPE / OCEANIA Five of you. Five of them. Face off in a tactical battle where everything you build, destroy, construct or shoot has devastating impact on the entire game. Build your defences and charge into action to destroy theirs. Tunnel under the map or catapult over it, they’ll never see it coming! Be sneaky, be devious, be destructive. Be a large metal robot, twisted scientist, deadly ninja and more. Build using a crazy range of block types and work together as a maverick team in this FPS where no game is ever the same. Ready up! It’s time to Block N Load.Tell Me More!NO GAME THE SAME: The game world is ever-changing and evolving throughout every match, as players creatively build and tunnel their way to enemy positions and onto victory. UNHINGED HEROES: Character variety offers a robust mix of roles for full combat, defensive and supportive players in a team. BRAINS AS IMPORTANT AS BULLETS: Every game has a blend of intelligent and creative tactics fused with strategic shooter action. It’s fast-paced yet strategic. BUILD PHASE: Experiment and take the time to work on your defences, traps and setups before the team attacks truly begin. MASTERS OF CONSTRUCTION: Creative use of a wide choice of blocks in-game mean your deadly and devious constructions can cause havoc with the enemy – and the map. WHAT THE BLOCK!? Big bombs, turrets, bounce pads, poison traps, landmines, forcefields, speed pads, mortars, glue blocks, health blocks, ammo blocks and more. Everything you need for calculated mayhem. RANKED PLAY: Play for global accolades within the tiered Ranked Play system. Prove your worth against the rest of the best. CUSTOM GAME MODE: Set up your own game on the servers to choose your favourite map and build time.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												This game has a ton of content. Nine characters, somewhere in the range of 15-20 maps, and each character also has a selection of different building blocks/traps/explosives/etc. they can pick from. Each match feels different due to the variety of approaches you can take such as tunneling underneath, planting a respawn pad behind your enemies base and having your entire team flank them, or just blowing everything up with a rocket launcher. The only downside is the small community, which makes it hard to learn or find tutorials on advanced techniques such as the best cutting locations for each map (where you cut the bottom blocks of a large structure to make it fall down and earn bonus blocks for your team).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
												This is a quick review, summs up my short playtime of this game, and the things you will see if you start playing.This is a class based voxel FPS with the building style of minecraft and a similar class system to a mixure of LoL and Team Fortress. Each week, three characters are free to play, and during that period, they cost less. Currently there is around 15 characters.The gameplay is simple.Two teams of five, drafted with the matchmaking system od LoL.Few minutes when the teams are blocked from each other, this is the time to construct your defenses and set up a special offense strategy(like digging a straight tunnel right under the surface, just to place a respawn pad below the enemies base), then the game starts, time to shoot each other, destroy the enemies defense and base, while defending yours.You need teamwork, much.Most people of the growing community understand that, but there are some kids raised on CoD and BF, who think their defense is supperior and everyone else just blocks them(some kid actually started remowing my turrets and radars from the places i placed them, just to get angry when i rebuilt them.), or think they will win the match by running and gunning(no, that does not work).The graphics are good, for the style of the game, but it has pretty big requirements.The sounds are good.I have only encountered one bug, when i, with the sniper class killed 3 enemies in short range combat with my revolver, because i did'nt take any damage until i was in prone.You get XP and money VERY slow, which might be annoying to some people.That goes for the game in overall, its kinda slow.The devs are amazing, they give the players every opportunity to express their thoughts, and they actually listen.There are some problems, like the game is very much based on offense right now, and there are some very OP ways to win(digging a tunnel, building over the map and stuff like that.So thats it.A good but still developing game of its kind(compared to many abominations), with a developing community, some bugs, and somewhat high requrements.I would say its worth a shot, its free after all.Beause its still in development, this might change in the future, but right now this game is just amazing.I give this game 9.5/10. TRY IT! I KNOW YOU WANT TO!!!

content:
Posted: October 15, 2015
												9/10Very great game with great mechanics. Honestly, I find myself playing it more than any other game on my computer and I have at least 50. It doesn't take a high performance computer to play. I play it on my laptop with 40+ FPS.There are interesting characters and skins. The many blocks, gadgets and defenses are absolutely awesome. There's a very tactical method to the game. If you just go in blindly shooting, you probably won't get far. A lot of the time you have to sacrifice kills for winning.Over-all, I love this game. A very beautiful blend of FPS and Minecraft (not in a bad way at all.) The only issue is some minor pay-to-win elements but it's nothing to be too concerned about. Just needs some balancing, in my opinion.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
												PROSNo pay to win mechanics only paid skinsNice selection of characters and three play stylesUnique game play not like other shooters you can build and shootMatch making is quick, balanced and it's easy to get into a matchMax of 3 people in a party so no 5 premade stomps if you go soloSimple game to learn but a hard game to master at high ranksRuns on low and high spec PC'sGame devs communicate often and updates are frequent including balancingMap editor and custom gamesCONS Low level and early play can be very frustrating until 10-15 hour markCommunity is strong but needs more players (it's not dying though 1500+ a day)Better choice of paid skins most of the skins aren't very excitingSo I'm re-writing my review now this is Free To Play, I was a paid player however the game was dying due to lack of players, I'm glad it's free because there's now over 1500 active players daily on Steam and the game is in a much better state! Firstly unlike a lot of free games here's no pay to win which will please lots of people everything is unlockable over time apart from the skins and cosmetics which you need real cash for. Paid players who bought the game before it was free get character unlocks and skins as a reward for buying the original. Block n Load in my opinion is in the top ten best free to play games on the Internet or Steam. It's primary a shooter but has some Minecraft building mechanics and 5v5 game play like a moba which I'll explain below.This game is simple but great though you need to get through your first 20-25 matches before you start getting team mates who know how to play and want to improve and learn the meta. Early on people clearly have no idea how to play, they troll a lot and argue and make stupid decisions which lose matches quickly. Low level players think they are playing team deathmatch game and generally do stupid♥♥♥♥♥♥so expect 10 hours of frustration before the game comes into it's own.  Once you hit match 25+ or above half of those lowbies carry on playing and get better and the others leave. Things get very fun once the competitive players remain and only the core community who understand the game are left.Matches in general can last between 10-30 minutes and some occasionally an hour when teams are very well matched on the bigger maps. I love jumping on with a friend or two and found teaching new friends to play was nice and easy as there's a tutorial video and you can make custom games. What I enjoy most about Block N Load is some games are a long tactical slog where as others are rush rush rush and lots of killing and carnage with a quick win or defeat. One match you might be dug in on a stale mate and others you push early and gain the upper hand for a quick victory.Block N Load certainly feels like a moba mixed with shooter mechanics and Minecraft block placement. It's matches feature 5v5 gameplay, choice of loadouts, cool skins and there is a kind of meta for each champ some are attacking and others defending play styles. There isn't any minions or skill trees like you'd get in a moba but your base is effectively the nexus or objective.As you can see from the pics and vids it uses Minecraft like voxel graphics and engine which suits it nicely. It runs very well and is stable I never experience disconnection from their servers or get lag at all I've played ona 4mb connection and my home 70mb fibre. The combat is first person shooter like where you shoot other players with a small selection of weapons and fit out your character with perks and building objects but the moba element is basically two teams attack and defend each others cubes (Nexus) trying to destroy it to win.Think DOTA/LOL but without minions, no buffs and there's no number based combat or pointing and clicking. Just a side note I have never ever seen a hacker on this game either!So basically to explain a match or the core game play a you get a build phase/resource gather phase which is normally 5 minutes to prepare your cube defence. After that a shield wall goes down and you battle until one team loses all their cubes (some maps have more than one). There's not much else to say it's build then fight and then either win or lose. Games can be pretty intense and action happening all the time. My only complaint is the game should force at least one player to play an engineer or defensive class as sometimes you can lose a match in character select and build phase if no one on your team can build decent walls, traps or turrets. The game can be won or lost in hero selection and in build phase if a player disconnects or leaves they are replaced very quickly, this is a great feature.Block n Load is the best voxel based builder and shooter game out there!

												This game was fantastic in beta and even more fantastic now. Its a great game to play with your friends. If you want to have fun and just mess around and build i dont recommend this game for you but if you want to get competitive and work as a team to win this is a perfect game to you. Some people think of Minecraft the first time they see it, why you wonder? Probably beacuse you use blocks and you build with them. Minecraft and Block n Load are like two different worlds. Minecraft go creative do whatever you want. In Block n Load you can be very creative but in a different way. Maybe in minecraft you build a really nice castle you and your pigs can live in while in Block n Load you build a strategic base with maybe cool traps and defences. Before you buy Block n Load you probably wanna find somone to play with. It can get a bit repetitive at some times but there are many different maps and actully alot of events with maps and new playable characters in a limited time. Dont judge from if i do a thums down or thumbs up. I recommend the game to people who like strategic, "creative" and wants a game to play with your friends :).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
												Actualy liked Ace of Spades. Figure I'd give this a try too. Launch game. Get all set up with character and watch loading video. Hey, looks hopefull! Click lanch game. 25 mins later it queus me into a group. Ok, new game with small playerbase I figure. Lets see how it plays. Join ingame, figure out how to procede to gear out my character with zero instructions it gave before hand, not too bad you can figure it out I figure. Players start harrasing other players who couldent figure it out fast enough... Well, there are allways gonna be a**h**** in games, nothing new right?Finaly get in match. Start building up defences... Fall to my death because teammates are leveling everything.... Well, at least there is block physics right!?Start building again with bumpers to jump up high. Teammates start placing blocks to block bouncers....  ok..Start to play game, typical fast paced shooter. Nothing new or out of the "norm" of other games. Linear maps that force player interaction which is good. Team gets rushed with in 2 mins. Surrender on screen and team surrenders. 25+ mins of waiting, over in under 8mins (including 5 mins of initial build time). Get to scoreboard. Figure, "Well, it was just a bad round, happens in anygame, lets try again!" Ok, so how do we get into the next round? Looking... Looking... Looking.... Seeing everyone "discconect" one by one... Realize, you don't get another round! You don't requeue... Only one button, return to menu to start this "fun" series of events over from the begining.... Well, that's enough of that. The way it seems now, this game is not gonna get enough player traction to go anywhere. Then, noticed the price they will try to sell this for... I would have been dissapointed at the $9.99 mark. But $30.00? WOWZA. GL to this game. In its current state, its gonna need all the luck it can get. Final verdict. Get the beta for free and give it a try as long as you can bear it. Perhaps things will improve as time goes on, as is the point to Beta's. If nothing changes... I wouldent even think of spending money on this.***TAKE 2***If you would like to hear how the second round went, scroll to the top of this review and re-read.

content:
Posted: October 1, 2015
												I was a beta tester for Block N Load, so I've been playing it since the very beggining, and to be honest, there was nothing wrong with the pay-to-play version. It feels like Jagex realy took down the game's quality in an attempt to make this game more widely available. I mean, we used to have all heros and the only problem I can think of is a semi-long que time, not to mention the fact that most people had to pay $30 for this, and are only compensated with a $10 premium package. But with the addition of having to buy heros, perks, and other things, it seems that this once great game is going to freemium purgitory. However, the game is very innovative and fun, especialy if you're a fan of minecraft or TF2. overall, I would give this game a 7.8/10 for the new updates. Please Jagex, if your reading this, make some sort of change for everyone who is very dissapointed, who bought the game and are now disgraced by the fact that they have to share a que with unskilled free-to-play players who only make the game that much more frustrating. I would recomend something like a server for premium members, or even better, a remake of the origional.

												Love this game, incorperates a suprisingly detailed and strategic foundation for such a simple looking game, the atmosphere is light and not too serious yet it caters towards thinking not mindless point and clicking. Different characters, different abilities, all having their own unique playstyle,movement animations,weight, size.  dialogue. which is something i find very refreshing when playing with some good friends with good team coordination.Teamwork, or atleast communication is absolutely essential for having an effective outcome and it encourages players to tailor their strengths to compensate the weaknesses of their teammates and vise versa. metas are starting to form and deform as this game gains new players everyday and its a thrill to observe.I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes to put their reflexes to the test aswell as their creativity.

content:
Posted: February 28, 2016
												I'm not an FPS gamer, but this is what they should be in my reckoning. Fun, funny, made up of layers (as in "not just mindless killing"), and with ever-evolving experiences. No game is ever the same, as the developers were so keen to point out. You can play the same map many times over, but the building (and destroying) element of the game allows for infinite strategies. Of course, you have to figure out which ones are the most effective...The heroes you can play as are diverse, with their own amusing dialogue and weaponry, and the gameplay is intuitive.However, the one problem I have experienced is the occasional lack of teamwork. For example, the start of the game can be awkward when you prepare your base and don't know which blocks you should put down because you don't know what kind of base your team wants.Even so, this game is a gem. I mean, what's not to like about running headfirst into the front lines with mortars blasting away, or sneaking underneath the enemy base to pop up with a surprise attack as you prepare a camp nestled in the lion's den, or perching atop towers in the ultimate sniper stake-out as you take potshots at the enemy with healing stations and ammo supplies trustily keeping you alive?Just...download it. You'll see what I mean soon enough!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 24, 2015
												A decent game combining tf2 and ace of spade, but it falls a bit flat.1) you have no characters to start off with. You get to use 3 characters for free, in a cycle (think league of legends). This doesn't do anything but make the characters you got good at disapear until they're back in the cycle or you buy them with either a) in game currency htat takes a while to earn or b) your own money. This is stupid. It doesn't add anything to the game and just messes up what could be a fun free-to-play game. I want free to play, not fee to pay.2) no single player with bots. this means if you have bad internet, don't buy this game.3) as of this review, there's only one main gamemode - classic, in which you defend your core and attack the other teams core. it need a capture the flag mode or something else to make the game better.4) respawn times feel a tad to long, with them being between 10-15 secconds usually, it rips you out of the action and makes you just sit there5) needs better server selection and more server capabilities. look at tf2 with its excess of server type, with different add-ons and plugins that make the game last a lot longer.6) skins can only be bought with real cash. your money takes ages to get anyways, let me buy a skin for my characterall in all a decent free-to-play game that sadly falls flat 7.5/10, would reconmend but because its for free and has a decent concept behind it

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												I have not yet put 100 hours into this game (at the time of this review) and I already have over half the availible characters (aas of 2/16/2016). The economy in this game is fantastic, it is not P2W, and it is not a super hard grind to get gold either. There are personal missions that reset every day, with rewards for completing them either fully or partially. This game is also a great game to play for fun, as its comical nature and easy-to-learn play style make it an enjoyable game for anyone willing to play. This game also doesn't have many trolls, as there is not much for them to do to harm their team, lest they be subject to the working report system (yes, it actually works). If you are interested in playing this game or want to learn more, please either check out the Block N Load website www.blocknload.com or watch the character videos in-game under the characters profile, as it greatly helps you to learn how each character works. The community is, hands down, the best player community I have ever played with. If I ever need help, I ask either in team or all chat and I get actual responses to my questions, not some troll spamming chat with 'Darude - Sandstorm' All in all, I rate this game 11/10, would play over and over and over again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 9, 2016
Block'N'LoadA game that took minecrafts graphics stuffed it into a bag and added a pinch of logic and CODThis game at first was just a random download bored didnt what to play...... but as soon as I pressed "play" I was brought on to a confusing new game.What's The StoryWell nothing just online gaming more a less.But you do lv and have league status which increases each time you win a match.If you lost a game dont worry you lose anything until you gold league but(again) you mst play as a lv 10 hero to gain or lose :DMoney?In BNL you gain gold bars you need alot to get characters which is okay :£You can buy them with "platnium" but that costs moneyPlatnium is more useful for getting hero skins (Some of them look badass)You gain about 1.2k gold bars for your three challenges you get per day(not to bad)Lv 10 hero's give you 1kSPeed runs give you 1k for just finishing (Hard enough)After a while you've got a good bit and you wanna  buy that hero, then you do gr8 bant3rYou gain 50 Gbar's on win or lose,75 on win and 175 on first one of the day(challenges gold are added is well)Hero's14 hero's3 typesBrawn(offensive)Skill(Defensive/offensive)Brains(Defensive)3 hero's 1 from each type will be on Free rotationCheapest hero are 2.7k Gold bars Most exspensive is 20.8kGameplay/modes1 mode destroy the enemies cubes and base or just baseGraphics are good even on lowAnd......................Balenced yis 69/79     Signed by ~Deerth Vad-er

Block'N'LoadA game that took minecrafts graphics stuffed it into a bag and added a pinch of logic and CODThis game at first was just a random download bored didnt what to play...... but as soon as I pressed "play" I was brought on to a confusing new game.What's The StoryWell nothing just online gaming more a less.But you do lv and have league status which increases each time you win a match.If you lost a game dont worry you lose anything until you gold league but(again) you mst play as a lv 10 hero to gain or lose :DMoney?In BNL you gain gold bars you need alot to get characters which is okay :£You can buy them with "platnium" but that costs moneyPlatnium is more useful for getting hero skins (Some of them look badass)You gain about 1.2k gold bars for your three challenges you get per day(not to bad)Lv 10 hero's give you 1kSPeed runs give you 1k for just finishing (Hard enough)After a while you've got a good bit and you wanna  buy that hero, then you do gr8 bant3rYou gain 50 Gbar's on win or lose,75 on win and 175 on first one of the day(challenges gold are added is well)Hero's14 hero's3 typesBrawn(offensive)Skill(Defensive/offensive)Brains(Defensive)3 hero's 1 from each type will be on Free rotationCheapest hero are 2.7k Gold bars Most exspensive is 20.8kGameplay/modes1 mode destroy the enemies cubes and base or just baseGraphics are good even on lowAnd......................Balenced yis 69/79     Signed by ~Deerth Vad-er
