												great game 10/9. but didn't know what to review so instead i made this peanut butter-chocolate cookie recipe.INGREDIENTS1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, (spooned and leveled)1 teaspoon baking soda1 cup peanut butter (smooth or chunky)4 tablespoons ( 1/2 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature1/2 cup packed dark-brown sugar1/2 cup granulated sugar2 large eggs1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract8 ounces semisweet chocolate, cut into chunksDIRECTIONSPreheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, whisk together flour and baking soda; set aside. In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat peanut butter, butter, and sugars until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla, and beat until smooth. With mixer on low, gradually add flour mixture, beating just until combined. Stir in chocolate chunks.Drop dough by heaping tablespoons, 1 inch apart, onto two large baking sheets. Bake until golden, 13 to 15 minutes, rotating sheets halfway through. Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool.

content:
Posted: October 27, 2015
												Okay, i am a huge tf2 fan and play minecraft when i am bored.. But you didn't ask this, no you didn't, but that's what's the wiki says: '' ..takes a bit from Minecraft, a little of Team Fortress and mashes it together..''.But the trailer of the game says ''no games the same''.So, which is right? Well i say NO game is EVER the same. TF2 is a gem and games that say they are like tf2 are just saying they a multiplayer objective based FPS with a cartoony style. TF2 is so much more than this, you could give a thousand more tags.This is not minecraft ethier, minecraft has a very strong indie style and is very customisable, this game just uses the block mechanic and there are a thousand games that do also.So what makes Block N Load not like any other game, it's because of its way if posing the matches, the way you have a build time and you need to defend and attack . But what some people may criticise but i think is what makes the game awesome is gold system and the way you buy heros and level up and get perks, if these systems weren't in place i would have played 1 round and went, this is because i play to level up and get enough gold to get the next hero or a new perk it's great and keeps you coming back for more because when you unlock a new hero it's not like you got a new skin or new rank you now have a WHOLE NEW playstyle to play around with.I love this game and unlike most new multiplayer FPS’s there's always a match running for you to jump right into. Download for FREE now and make sure you block and load.Have fun!!

												my search is FINALLY over!i have been looking for a multiplayer game that i haven't gotten bored of and that i could find fun for a while. i saw yesturday that block n load went free to play. i didn't buy it because i never found any matches in the beta and i wasn't sure if i'd enjoy it but now that its free to play i thought i'd try it. turns out its fun.matches can be a pain to find but at the time i'm writing this review it takes me up to 3 minutes to find a match but usually it doesn't take that long. the reason it takes so long is when you find a match you have to click the accept button and some people don't know how to do that by the looks of it.who ever says it takes a long time to find a match OR that block n load is pay to win is full of♥♥♥♥♥♥ it doesn't take long to find a match and the ONLY thing you have to pay for is skins EVERYTHING else can be earned by playing the game.also people who own a tropico game might get a skin of el presidente from the game for block n load. i tried the beta but the skin i know i have looks too much like el presidente from tropico to be a beta reward so i think you have to own tropico to get it. by you have to own tropico to get the skin i mean 3 or 4 (those are the only tropico games i own) but it may be for all the games OR theres a VERY small chance it could be for playing the beta so if anyone finds out which it is let me know!

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												This game is choc-a-block with cool features. It’s like playing and FPS version of Lego! The shooter part is pretty classic, and if you are into other FPS titles, you'll enjoy this game already. But it has so much more to offer than that! This game is highly tactical: you need to protect your base and find the best way to breach enemy defences. Each character has a role to play and can contribute differently to the defence of your base and the destruction of the enemy. The game is great fun and I definitely recommend it. Thumbs up!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 4, 2015
												Saw this trending on steam over weekend and tried it out, had tons of fun and bought it after free play period ended.While its only one game mode (several maps) the amount of things you can try on defense and offense has kept the game from getting stale for me so far.  Classes all feel pretty good, engineer specifically feels like a defense only class due to short range of shotgun and repair secondary but i guess thats to be expected somewhat.Pretty high time to kill which is a nice change of pace compared to most modern shooters.  Shooting and movement interaction is somewhat unique, you can move across map and up ledges very rapidly though you move very slowly while actively shooting, seems to simultaneously make positioning very important for the shooter while allowing enough fast movement for others to close into better range quickly, and also allowing for rapid escapes.  Its somewhat unique but i think the system works well here.Even if not a shooter player at all, the building portion of game is just as important, and you could just focus on mining / setting traps and not fire a gun all match and still be pretty helpful to your team.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Fun if you play with a few friends. Not sure the $30 price will ever be justified based on what I've seen. Even $20 is steep imo. Gifted by a friend, can't say I would've bought it. Now onto the game. Don't let the animation fool you, this game's not just for kids. There are tons of different strategies you can use and the different classes make for a relatively fresh experience everytime you play. Especially when you have 5 people who have half a clue what to do, it can be very fun. But....- needs a TON of balance work- you can just play as Sarge and spam rockets to win- the tank class isnt even a tank (a mortar cant blow up a sandbag?)- the ninja can spam endless throwing stars- you can't leave a match- achievements are bugged- you can't votekick or replace a player, so an afk usually means a loss- no voice chat, super important for a game like this- too many viable cheap, trolling options for easy, boring victories- map design in general needs work, and more maps addedI understand the game isn't fully released yet, and hopefully the game has an active dev team that is aware of most of this. I could certainly sink some hours into this game. I'd say keep an eye on it, and look for updates/reviews. Personally I wouldn't pay $20-30 for it right now.

												At first I thought it was just another low effort minectaft shooter for free on steam that I would play one game with some friends just to mess around. 												block n load, a game that IF you played the original which was ace of spades you would probably have 2 opinions of this game :opinion A: your extremely glad to see that the idea of a sand box first person shooter isnt dead and you really want to buy this game :opinion B: your not sure wether or not you should buy this game after the train wreck which was ace of spades. now first of all i want to say this game does a sand box first person shooter REALLY well, to a point where i would call this the first sandbox shooter game in history (that i know of), it has 6 characters to choose from and they are all amazing in their own way's, and speaking of ways this game did things right i personally love the art style of this game, now at first this game seems like it takes alot of its art style from tf2 and i see where that comes from, but in my eyes it reminds me of toy story in the way it looks and feels which is a HUGE throw back that i welcome with open arms, the only problem this game has is that its abit TO team based, so if some A hole disconnects or if there is some guy running round not helping his team then I JUST LOST THE MATCH!, but aside from that the game is flawless in every way compared to the original ace of spades, im soo glad to see that what ace of spades was trying to accomplish didnt die in vain and now block n load is here to make what ace of spades failed to do into a dream come true.

Posted: November 9, 2015
												I bought the game when you had to pay for it and I played it with a friend we had fun thought the game was amazing it was something different that once you knew what you were doing you had a wonderful time. Then soon after, the free to play update came out. I did not care much for the update but what got me was the poor amount of compensationt hey gave for people. Instead of letting us still get all current and future heroes they give us a skin pack and tell us we now need to purchase future heroes. A skin pack does not compensate the amount spent to pay for it. What makes things worse is this attracted the FTP crowd of children that make communities so much worse. These kids jump on anything they can find that looks good and is free to play and just make the community♥♥♥♥♥♥ For example now instead of balanced teams which were easy to coordinate with reasonable people everyone wants to be the sniper and God help you if you try to tell them otherwise. Kids like snipers kids want to be mlg so they pick the kit they think will make them mlg. These kids focus on setting up their little bases to camp and snipe from mostly leaving the core exposed. 90% of games I have played the only person building defenses was me. I would also like to add the complete lack of looking for the objective as all these kids do is go off on their own and try to get as many kills as possible. It almost feels like there is no objective at all other than shoot the enemy snipers. The only way to counter this stupid strategy is to dig under the map and crawl your way to the cores which they NEVER try to defend. This game used to be fun with mutual defensive builds and tactics to get in but now its just dig under the snipers and win this game quickly turned from fun action to how much longer am I going to dig my way through this game. I am extremely disappointed the way the developers screwed over everyone that supported the game when they paid for it and let the community fall to the FTP kids that kill all FTP communities. If you want to play this game anyway after reading the review I recommend planetside 2, first person shooter in which people actually DEFEND THE BASES AND PUSH AT APPROPRIATE TIMES. the kits are also free so save the grind.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 2, 2015
												I have played this game throughout its time in Beta, and therefore have formed a few rudimentary opinions. TL/DR: Buy it if you're a casual gamer, but if you hate the thought of losing through things which aren't necessarily your fault, this isn't for you.Firstly, there are many positive attributes to this game. These are: a good blend between building and combat, with what ultimately feels like two substantial halves, some good map diversity, and an enjoyable experience that can either end in 5 minutes of mayhem, or 30 minute long sieges with ridiculous defense lines. Both of these present their own challenges, and ultimately enjoyable experiences.However, the game falls down in both its players and design elements. Firstly, I have found the community to be less than helpful, with toxic players often weighing down games. Beyond this, a lack of rating results in you often being saddled with players far below the average level. Characters suffer from being unbalanced, and the game itself has issues with queue times and a limited pool of players. I think this game has potential to evolve into something great, and would personally say buy it, but given Jagex's record, dont expect them to listen to community advice anytime soon. Either way, if you're willing to cope with a sometimes toxic environment and losses you feel cheated on, this game is worth it's modest £10 price.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 27
												Do like First Person Shooters or Sandbox games? Well then what are you waiting for the download is free!There are quite a few one to two sentence reviews that say this or that but then you look at there playtime, it is usually under a few hours. In my opinion you should have at least 100 hours before you can really see the big picture of this game. Many reviews simply state this game is P2W which is just not true. Anything that affects gameplay can be bought with in game currency that you can earn, you guessed it, in game. Block N Load requires skill and that is something you can't just pay for. There are some cosmetics that you can to buy with real money but like I said right before this it is nothing that affects gameplay. After 200 hours of Block N Load I think this sums everything up...The Good: - Fun and unique combat mechanics for each hero.- Block N Load is visually pleasing even with lower graphics.- Literally an endless amount of possibilities for every match.- Fairly balanced in terms of mechanics and abilities (though some heroes can be a little better then others).- Can run on most computers/laptops considering my old laptop can run it on lowest settings fairly well.- Fully destroy-able terrain with a 5 minute build time (before the other team can attack you). - You can make some cool traps and defenses.  - 3 Different classes: Brawn, Skill and Brains. Each class has their own special class specific blocks along with general blocks that all classes can use.- You start out by not owning any heroes but there is always 3 different heroes (one in each class) that are free for anyone to play (I believe the rotations change weekly or every other). This allows you to try a hero before you buy it.- You usually get little gold (the main currency) when completing a match but quests (daily) and the single player time assault (every week) mode can make up for this.- Once you really understand Block N Load you will learn that is doesn't matter if you lose or win as long as you had fun!The Bad:- More people need Block N Load (Que times can be a little long sometimes).- Depending on your geographical location you may experience lag.- Need some programmers on Block N Load (To my knowledge there is currently just one developer that can only change things like system variables (dmg, health, movement speed, etc.).- Support (aka support tickets) has been slow according to others (I have not submitted any tickets myself).- Matchmaking is not the fairest but that is mostly just because more people need Block N Load.TL:DRBlock N Load is an extremely fun game that I recommend everyone to try out. It has a few flaws here and there but it is more then worth it to give this game a shot!So... WHAT THE BLOCK YOU GONNA DO!

content:
Posted: August 6, 2016
												Surprisingly fun. The moba-style character system actually works to keep the game interesting, and the maps are varied. A game can last anywhere from five to fifty minutes depending upon how competent your team is at building defenses during the preliminary phase. The only problems are the immature and clueless minecraft-playing fanbase and queue times (only about 1k active players). This game would be a blast with a more active community and demographic of ranked mode players.

content:
Posted: January 15, 2015
												One of the best games I've played in a while, if you're looking for a cartoony fun and exciting shooter, this is the game for you. Each class has it's own perks and when playing any of them you really lose track of time fast. I'm not quite sure it's worth $20 yet, mainly because the game hasn't received much publicity and the wait times for a game match can be up to 5 minutes depending on what time of day. Overall it deserves a 9/10.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 14, 2015
												I'll start by saying the mechanics are very good. The digging and building both work very well, and the shooting is fun. I don't think the shooting is anything revolutionary, but it's not bad by any means. The classes feel relatively balanced.Adding minecraft mechanics to a shooter doesn't actually add too much. It's an interesting concept, but there really isn't much it adds in terms of strategy (and it adds very little to shooting). There needs to be so much more done to really be tactical and deep.This game does all those things needed. While the game may only look like a shooter with minecraft mechanics, it uses those mechanics and many others to create a game all about tactics, resource management, and most of all deception.That's a very nice summary, but explaining why the game is about those things can't be done in a paragraph. The objective in this game is to defend your team's cube while destroying the enemy cube. There are so many strategies that both sides can use.Maybe you'll charge in and try to hit their cube with your shovel, maybe they'll have mines waiting for you. Maybe they'll dig under your base and try to disarm your traps, maybe you'll see them on your radar (which you have to set up, and can be destroyed) and dig down to them and throw some grenades in their tunnel. Maybe you'll try and sneak behind their enemy lines and set up a spawner so you can attack from a better angle, maybe they'll use radar to find and destroy it. Maybe they'll put down radars on your base to try and find your radars, and destroy yours, or you'll see them and stop them. Maybe you'll have a teammate set up some mortars and try to get close to call in a mortar strike on their defenses, maybe they'll send in a teammate to find and destroy the mortars. Maybe you'll build a bridge in the sky above their defenses, put a bomb down, and then destroy the block under it so it falls, maybe they'll dig out whatever's supporting your skybridge before that happens (blocks can't just float like in minecraft, they'll basically ragdoll if they're not attached to the ground at least through some other blocks touching it). Maybe they'll dig under your base and place bombs to completely devastate your defenses, maybe you'll disarm them, or maybe you'll turn the huge pits around your cubes into an even more effective defensive structure.There are so many ways to attack and defend in this game, and they give you so many tools to be creative.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
												Gotta be honest, this game is just... No. Just no. It's laggy, unbalanced and people even saying the TF2 name beside Block 'N' Load is just a complete insult (Even with the state TF2 is in currently). On paper combining Minecraft with an FPS might of sounded good and interesting, but thats on paper, when you bring it into actuallity, It's just straight up dumb. Even on paper it sounds pretty dumb. But when I first got this I went like "This is gonna be dumb and gimmicky", it sorta was, but it was still fun for a bit. But then the game got changed, Just like TMQFEL (The Mighty Quest For Epic Loot), They completely changed how things were. Completely ignoring "Don't fix something if it isn't broken" and the game suddenly got laggy, too many heros, unbalanced, and just it lost what it was, then they give some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t to people who already bought the full game with real money with some♥♥♥♥♥♥as skins just like Evolve, showing they don't give two ♥♥♥♥♥ about their audience.Overall my experience for this game was promising but as expected current gen developers don't give a damn about the audience or game and seem to be a bunch of idiots. Just... Don't get this game for your own good, even if it is free. It's a waste of memory space.

												I really do like this game, however unless you have a full squad with your friends or something you are pretty much garuanteed to have 12 year olds on your team that have no clue what they are doing. If you are a competitive person like myself, you will have a hard time enjoying this game. Also there are many people that just spam the chat since there are no restrictions. Once again if you are competitive like me - I hate to lose lol - then you might have a hard time enjoying this. I do really like the game, and think that when it grows and gets more people above the age of 12 then I will enjoy it more, however at the moment it is either AFK's, people that have no idea that there is even another team, and spammers. I recommend it because I see the potential that it has and can't wait for a little bit better community.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												As far as block based shooters go, Block N Load is the best in my opinion.Me and my friends are having a great time with this game. We experiment with new tactics and defenses. We co-operate and talk with each other more often than in any other game. Each victory we get together as a team, makes us more invested than before.I can understand why other people might not like this game. The gunplay is competent, but it is difficult to switch between weapons quickly. Charecters have a small amount of lines they spew out all the time, but at least they say somewhat humorous stuff.My only real complaint is that keybinding isn't compatible with all keys on the keyboard. For instance, I can't bind crouch to shift.All in all, I think Block N Load is a fun shooter, and is worthy of your time and money.Don't forget...Building is awesome.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22
												I would rate this a 4/5. It is an extremely well done game with thrills around every corner, however the base and cube mechanics leave much to be desired. On a map with multiple cubes, after the enemy destroys the first one it should not be a mad dash to the second one/the base to destroy it before you have a chance to respawn and defend it. A few ideas that could help are as follows:1. The forcefield around the second cube/base will disappear after a time instead of immediately after the first cube is destroyed2. Wall type barrier (Like the one at the beginning of the round) that will fall after a timeThose ideas would make the game much more enjoyable for many people that I know have the same frustration I do.Overall, Block N' Load is an amazing game, but needs some nerfing/buffing when it comes to the bases and cubes.Okay, more ranting and raving from me, thinking anyone is gonna care. I'm going to get right into business now. Yuri. Yuri sucks. Yuri needs to go back to Russia and die from frostbite. Then no one will ever care about his worthless body, and it will juts get packed under layers of snow until it inevitably rots into the waste it is. There... now that that's off my chest, lets talk about why. Yuri's snowballs. They can one hit Nigel (100 health) if he hits a headshot, while Nigel can only 4 shot Yuri with headshots. Let me remind you, Yuri has snowballs, Nigel has bullets. Are snowballs suddenly more effective than bullets? Let's take an in depth look. Bullets are launched using black powder, or gunpowder which can release them at an average of 2,500 FPS (feet per second) or 1,700 mph (2,735 kph) from the barrel of the gun. Snowballs are... well if you don't know how snowballs work, go throw one. So, what Block N Load is saying is that, instead of using guns and bullets in war... we should instead throw snowballs at the enemy? Of course, what have we been missing?! Snowballs are obviously the way to go, and simply put, are better than guns. Alright, let's get the SEAL team loaded up with their new snowballs, that'll scare ISIS. Whatever, I just wanna say that snowballs are nowhere close to the power of a bullet, and it should be represented accurately in the game.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2016
												All in all it is a great game. It's worth spending some time fooling around with. I used to play this game quite a lot, but when they switched to free-to-play they destroyed my entusiasm. All we loyal backers who bought the game got was a single skin from Nigel Longshot and all points we had gained over the year of playing was all gone. Heroes had to be either bought up with xp (for real money) or trained up all over again. Fighting one vs one with a unleveled character vs a fully leveled character = loss. Did also not help that you still appear in the top league because of your experience in the game and facing the hardcore players with your now low level heroes. I did not like the new direction and how they treated their loyal players who actually bought the game. At a minimum we should have recived at least one or two of the new characters for free. At a minimum. The game is in its basic fun to play. Chaos and structure well combined. But I do not like the producers any more. They ruined the game.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
												A fun FPS with a twist.  Choose one of serveral characters, outfit them with different placeable blocks/weapons/etc., and start the match.  You have about five minutes to build defenses on your side of the map, and then the separating wall comes down and you defend your cubes and bases, while trying to destroy those of the enemy team.  Build up turrets and radar and walls for defense, charge straight for the enemy, or be a sneak and try to dig under enemy lines and place spawn points, bombs, and more on their side of the map.  Nearly every block in the game is destructible, so you have a lot of freedom.  Definitely worth trying.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												  I've gotta admit, Jagex really stepped up their game after the release of this beta. I remember when I used to play Ace of Spades, before Jagex bought the rights to it. I loved that damn game! I was REALLY bummed out that the creator, Ben Akoroy or something like that, decided to sell it to the ♥♥♥♥♥iest company that he could think of. How could you put so much time and work in to the game, only for it to be wasted and absorbed in to the trash heap, and then use the same game, only now it's covered in dog crap? I can confess, I was not thinking of the amount of things that Jagex ♥♥♥♥ed up, RuneScape, and now AoS. Even if you liked the new AoS, who the hell were you gonna play with? Servers on that game were empty, and now it's even MORE empty! I bet I can't even find ONE damn server that doesn't have the game mode "Classic" or "Zombies", and is full! Yeah, that's how much ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t I put up with Jagex. Fortunately, I don't have to put up with that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t anymore.SUMMARY: Good game, has several bugs, but these can be easily fixed with a build or two.PROS: Great idea, good elements (Blocks, traps, etc.), very fun as it's never possible to have a perfect building strategy, and as it states,  "No games the same".CONS: Few bugs, voice actor is not bad, but could be SO much better.8/10- The Nerd

content:
Posted: March 20
												THIS GAME IS FUN. However the tutorial for this game is♥♥♥♥♥♥ This results in what feels like %80 of people not knowing how to play the game. This is a team based game where there are 3 classes and you want a combination of the 3 types to achieve a good team dynamic. However, many people dont understand and dont care that if everyone plays 1 character that they really stand no chance. There is brawn/skill/brains roles and each type gets access to certain types of equipment others dont. brawn gets radars and respawn pads, skill gets movement pads and jump pads and the brains get health and ammo. These thing are to be placed around the base to keep it safe and around the map to get to the enemy cube as fast as possible. Many times there will be 1 brain on your team who doesnt put health or ammo/1 brawn on your team and he doesnt put radars/respawns.This game is great. Its fun and the mechanics are really interesting. However with this learning curve you will find that 8 out of 10 matches will always have 1-2 people who dont help on your team. losing 8 games in a row is a big waste of 2 and a half hours. They dont attack or defend. Matchmaking is also super unbalanced. There are times where you will be going against a party of 2 and a party of 3 with people all over level 100 and on your team have everyone under level 10 unless you have a friend or 2 with you. It's a 5v5 game so when 1-2 people are trolling (or griefing which is common) you stand no chance and just end up screaming at your monitor while the enemy team just spawn camps you and doesnt end the game because you get more ingame money the longer the match lasts.Finally the community of this game is toxic. If you play expect to get called a♥♥♥♥♥♥alot and have people troll you by destroying your teams health and ammo/turrets/defenses then quit out 1 second before game end so you cant report them. The worst part about this toxic community is that at any time unless playing ranked (servers only open on rare occassions) you can only have a party as large as 3. I would give this game a 7/10 but the community is so toxic and ally players are such trolls I would have to give it a 3/10. The game is simple, but people just dont know how to play it and it results in loss after loss after loss. sucks to have 30kills and 5death but your allies more often then not ending with 0 kill 30 deaths 0 items build and 0 team money made.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
												When I used to play, it was a bit of fun and a pleasant way to waste some time. No restrictions and a PROPER free to play model where you could access everything barring skins, some of which you could unlock just from playing as a hero for some time. At that point there were only 6 heroes.I come back to the game after roughly a year and all the issues with the game that were present still remain, a bunch of new "heroes" (which I have no idea as to why they were even implemented?) seem to fart around doing nothing special, you can no longer use any hero that you'd like to, you're stuck either grinding currency (which is also new) to unlock new heroes or just using the ones that are on rotation (free to use I guess). Previously, if my memory serves correctly, you had access to an array of blocks and utility items which were unique to each hero. (un)surprisingly, you now have to grind out levels to unlock these things which undoubtedly require more in game currency.Don't quote me on this though, I redownloaded the game to play with a friend, got lost in the new and unimproved UI, only played half a game then left due to the sheer incompetence of my "Team" mates. As somebody who signed up for the beta quite some time ago, it's perplexing (But probably not surprising) to see how a development team can make something Worse. Should you download Block 'N load? Sure, why not, it's free so what've you got to lose? But as far as I'm concerned it's just a dull, unengaging and a "not-worth-the-effort" time sink.

number of helpful: 13 of 25 people (52%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
												From my experience in playing this game, it may have been just 1 hour, but it was the worst hour of my life. Let's start this off with the servers. The servers are horrid. I had a 23 ping on the server (on average[US server]) and everyone else was lagging around like their getting their internet off of a dead raccoon.The Balance: There basically is none. Leveling up grants you more power basically. So a new player will have no chance of beating a higher level player.  As you level up, you gain access to more abilities such as lower active cooldowns, more uses on your active ability, and so on. And not to mention that you have to be level 6 to get access to change what blocks you can use. That might not sound bad, but here's the thing, those blocks have more heal, plus there's an actual bomb that you can use to destroy blocks. You'd figure that everyone would have acccess to it, right? Nope, you have to be level 6 to get it.  But wait, there's more. One would think that if you're new, you'd go against other new players, right? Wrong, you get thrown in with higher levels, so have fun trying to play a game where everyone who's played longer has abilities to destroy you instantly.The "heroes": They're okay at best, but the only way you can do anything to kill enemy heroes is pay to get better ones.On the topic of paying: The game has a P2W (Pay to win) system. You can pay for new, powerful heroes that will just destroy everyone else and there's nothing you can do about it. The IGC (In Game Currency) you get is literally nothing after any match making it so you have to literally grind the hell out of the game to even afford someone new to play. Yes there is a free rotation, but you still have to buy someone to play as no matter what (unless you wanna live off the rotation for the rest of your life). Last words: The game it's self is an "ok" game, it's just that all the bull♥♥♥♥♥♥that they just packed in makes it literally unenjoyable to play. The leveling system breaks it, the pay-for-perks system breaks it more, and the heroes that just destroy everyone else just puts the final nail in the coffin. A game may only be as good as the player, but when the game has too many broken aspects, the game is the bad one, not the player.

												I have been playing this game for only a few days and it seems pretty fun. This game has a combination of some of my favorite games such as league of legends, minecraft, etc. This game has it's own unique style which I love a lot. Of course there is a major flaw right now that I do not like about this game, and that would be the limited amount of people you can play with, currently you can only play with 3 people in a squad, previously only 2, at this point I would enjoy this game even more if there could be a total of 5 in a squad. Don't get me wrong, I love that you updated it to 3 people being able to be in a squad but I would see more potential in the game if there were more squad spots available such as 5. The game is great by itself and it will be a really great game if you can play with your friends. For now I will give it a thumbs down for it because I stopped playing it since I can't play with all my friends. Please add more squad members and my rating will surely be changed to a thumbs up. Wouldn't recommend it because usually the people I would recommend it to is my friends and I wouldn't be able to play with them due to the minimal amount of squad members.

content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
												Tactics and Strategy combined with creativity at its best.all yous out there who think this is minecraft or Tf2: lol no you are wrongits pretty much Base building games (no, not clash of clans) with a mix of FPS and a bit of Moba.The art of war is based heavyily on this and this game literally says: "take down the enemy core in anyway. You name it: explode it, dig under it, go above it, throw ninja stars at it, anything to take it down.Characters are diverse and (yes, its official) no game is ever the same. Adapting to your enemys strategy is a key thing in this game and most of the time you will struggle just to find the enemy as they slowly drain the life from your base ;_;A small learning curve with basic controls (rebinding keys for those people who just get comfortable with other controls)and teamwork is encouraged. Give it a try, its quite a good game.TL;DR: its good, get it

content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												6/10 In BetaI enjoy this game very much. I find building the defenses very relaxing at most times, and the offense very intense at times. A couple things do need worked out though.1. Spamming/GriefingI do not come across spammers or griefers too often but when I do it's very annoying. I feel there should be an anti-spam system and possibly a vote to kick for griefers.2. O.P. Juan Shinobi is very overpowered as he is VERY agile and can 2 hit sometimes 1 hit enemies.3. The sniper, Nigel, is underpowered with his primary weapon.4. Not very many maps. The map selection is very slim and they get old after a while.Other than those things the game is good. I just hope that the game does not become pay to win and those problems are fixed. :)To quote another reviewer about defending.  "you always have something to do and are not just sitting there in a corner with your level 3 sentery waiting for someone to come and take the intel."I just love this reference.

												Pretty fun game. But the playerbase feels pretty low at times considering I was in queue for like 10-20min before finding a game. Involved a lot of teamwork and coordination for plays and attacking/defending. The game doesn't seem P2W since the only premium currency is used to buy cosmetics. The only thing I suggest is for casual queueing; I want to queue with more than 2 other of my friends compared to ranked which has up to 5 man queue.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 11, 2015
												Has Minecraft gotten boring for your 12 year old self? Do you want something different than Team Fortress 2 or Dota 2? Do you want to blow the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of the enemy base? Then Block N' Load is for you!Not only is it free, but it's actually good! This is one of the few games that shine in the Free To Play section of Steam, which really says something when almost everything in the F2P section of Steam is complete garabage. In Block N' Load, you and 4 other teammates must destroy the enemies base (Cube) to win, while your opponents try to do the same. Before each round, you choose to defend or attack. Next, you pick your class (You start out with 3 and can buy more with in-game cash which you get from matches) and select your perks and blocks. Before the fighting begins, there is a small setup round which allows you to build defenses or traps around your base. Once that's over, you get to work with your team to defend and attack, blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up along the way as the map gets ripped to shreds. Most of the map is fully destructable, and it's always a great feeling to destroy structures or bring down buildings with explosives.The community isn't too bad, and many seem to be helpful towards new players. Although you`ll still get a fair helping of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s in the game. It's very easy to start playing and even easier to get addicted to this drug of a game. Preformance wise, it runs alright on my computer (My computer isn't meant for gaming). This game isn't Pay 2 Win, although paying allows you to get Heros faster, get perks faster, and allows you to buy skins. I seriously reccomend this game, I`m loving it more than a Happy Meal with a Neo pet inside. Go get youself somthin' nice and play Block N' Load.Verdict: 9/10 "A game where you have these blocks, and you load them"

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 13, 2015
												Pretty fun game its like TF2 and minecraft mashed up into a game. Had the opportunity to play this thanks to the keys given to my esports society in Manchester.TL;DR Pretty fun game with a nice concept but some balancing may still be needed in terms of team composition.Long wall of text here of my nitpicking opinion mostly from playing solo (because giving a review based on a group of us playing each other without a clue of what's going on isnt really a review xD):Pros:Gameplay wise is really fun to prepare your base and see how well it fares against one another. Thinking of creative ways to build a defend from turrents and tikis flanking the cube to underground mines that will leave a nice surprise for tunnelers is really satisfying when you see it working.Attacking is also really fun with multiple revenues of assault. Ive seen various creative ways people attempt to siege ranging from backdoor spawn point assaults to overhead bombing using a bridge which all ends in a beautiful carnage. The reaction on the opponents face when you successfully destroyed half their defenses with a giant bomb from down under is really satisfying.The characters are really unique with each character bringing something different to the lineup (other than Sarge and Cogwheel whom I feel both are more or less the same in terms of weapons and playstyle). The maps are also unique with each map having a different building style to ensure its fortitude.Cons:I would hope there would be more effective long range sieging/front up assault methods. In most cases long range attacks via rocket launchers and etc would just get patched up too easily by new blocks or the turret guy's repair gun.  Playing cogwheel for example, I felt that its fairly pointless to attempt to break the enemy walls up front with my cannon considering the damage will be patched up when I respawn and return to it.Upfront assaults will rarely work too with most of the defense mechanisms shredding you within seconds unless your team have 3 "Sweet Sciences" rushing your base which is pretty scary if you're the defense. I would debate that using bombs  are considered to be upfront but as long as the opponents are somewhat decent they would easily spot your attempts and foil it before you could even plant the bomb. I feel you guys should work on improving  long range sieging/upfront method since it's the most generic approach most people would think of and it should be at least somewhat viable rather than relying on sneaky tricks or incompetent defense players.There were also a few moments of server lag which causes everyone to freeze and we had to leave the game prematurely. Hopefully you guys found the source of this issue. Also the number of times I have died from shift climbing a wall into oblivion is countless. Not sure if its just me but I feel there should be a slight pause for whenever you climb using that method rather than continuing to sprint after you reached the top.

content:
Posted: October 2, 2015
												Not another minecraft-like shooter. It's actually full of tactics and well-balanced catchy ideas that may simultaneously remind you of team fortress 2 with it's classes, ace of spades with it's building system, any strategy or tower defense game with the option of placing various traps for enemies before the round. What's also important it's not played like your weapon and character are both made of wood. It has decent physics and dynamics alongside decent aiming and recoil.I haven't played this game much, as you can see. But I can assure you it will be pretty fun, especially with a friends or two on your side. Damn, I sound like I'm selling this♥♥♥♥♥♥ Just try the game if you want. Don't if you don't. I don't really care. Have a nice day! : )

content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
												Imagine this game to be a blend of numerous video games into one. It's a unique design, it's a first person shooter in a 5v5 setting with the sole of goal of protecting your base and its assets while destroying your enemy's base and their assets.The inclusion of being dictate and shape your base is a strong plus for the game.  Destructible environments are in this game and because of that, this game utilizes mechanics similar to Minecraft to create a dynamic environment. You and your team can create strategic ploys to seize victory.The only problem with this game is that some characters are actually useless while there are characters like  O.P. 'Juan' Shinobi that are absolutely ruthless and can dish out major damage, flee, and rejuvenate hp and ammo in moments alongside with being able to just vanish and gain some cover. It's not game-breaking, but pair this with an experienced player and that player alone can probably solo the match. The game needs to be tweaked more for balancing, all classes have their strong points, but there's no reason ever to not use Juan as he is a reliable offense and one hell of a defense character.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 11, 2015
												Has Minecraft gotten boring for your 12 year old self? Do you want something different than Team Fortress 2 or Dota 2? Do you want to blow the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of the enemy base? Then Block N' Load is for you!Not only is it free, but it's actually good! This is one of the few games that shine in the Free To Play section of Steam, which really says something when almost everything in the F2P section of Steam is complete garabage. In Block N' Load, you and 4 other teammates must destroy the enemies base (Cube) to win, while your opponents try to do the same. Before each round, you choose to defend or attack. Next, you pick your class (You start out with 3 and can buy more with in-game cash which you get from matches) and select your perks and blocks. Before the fighting begins, there is a small setup round which allows you to build defenses or traps around your base. Once that's over, you get to work with your team to defend and attack, blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up along the way as the map gets ripped to shreds. Most of the map is fully destructable, and it's always a great feeling to destroy structures or bring down buildings with explosives.The community isn't too bad, and many seem to be helpful towards new players. Although you`ll still get a fair helping of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s in the game. It's very easy to start playing and even easier to get addicted to this drug of a game. Preformance wise, it runs alright on my computer (My computer isn't meant for gaming). This game isn't Pay 2 Win, although paying allows you to get Heros faster, get perks faster, and allows you to buy skins. I seriously reccomend this game, I`m loving it more than a Happy Meal with a Neo pet inside. Go get youself somthin' nice and play Block N' Load.Verdict: 9/10 "A game where you have these blocks, and you load them"

content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
												Likes:- Prep Time Allows for Various Defensive Measures- Large Selection of Heroes with Three Always on a Free Rotation- Solid FPS Gameplay Enhanced with Building and Special Blocks (Mines, Traps, Bounce Blocks, Booster Blocks, Ect)- Hero Perk Upgrades Enhance your Abilities- Every Hero is Unique- Family Friendly Art Style- All Heros Available Via Ingame Means- No Match is Ever the Same- Very Accessible - Meeting Special Requirements During Matches Earns Extra Gold- Divisions and Levels Show off Skill and DedicationDislikes:- New Players can Bring Down the Entire Team- The Newest Heros are Very Expensive Via Ingame Gold- ALL Skins require cash paymentsFinal Score:- 9/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
												Tactics and Strategy combined with creativity at its best.all yous out there who think this is minecraft or Tf2: lol no you are wrongits pretty much Base building games (no, not clash of clans) with a mix of FPS and a bit of Moba.The art of war is based heavyily on this and this game literally says: "take down the enemy core in anyway. You name it: explode it, dig under it, go above it, throw ninja stars at it, anything to take it down.Characters are diverse and (yes, its official) no game is ever the same. Adapting to your enemys strategy is a key thing in this game and most of the time you will struggle just to find the enemy as they slowly drain the life from your base ;_;A small learning curve with basic controls (rebinding keys for those people who just get comfortable with other controls)and teamwork is encouraged. Give it a try, its quite a good game.TL;DR: its good, get it

content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												Doc Eliza Doolally is a fun to verse fun to play hero. She utilizes mechanics such as: Tilt Feeders and low elo players. Never have I lost a match since they buffed her already busted kit. Now my winrate is 100% since the patch and I kill people through walls with my chem grenades. Sadly in the height of Doc Eliza's prime my real main Tony has fallen off. He now only  1 shots people and can't 1 shot with turrets. I really hope they buff him next patch. My next character to highlight is Kreepy. He is very fun and requires high skill such as: Jumping over the tallest walls and one shotting every character (Expect for Cogwheel) I am now coming up to my real main. Cogwheel. Or as I like to call him: "The moving win condition" 270 health is very fun to verse and I like the way that all defenses explode when he just breathes on them. His minigun has fun mechanics and really gives that raidboss feel. Will he one shot me from far away? Or one shot me up close. Very fun. I love his mortars they really ruin the sense of building together since you grief your teams base for blocks to make enough to be useful with them. My next favourite character is Astarella. She has really fun mechanics  such as: destroying everything that the enemy team did in their five minute build phase and tilts the enemy defenders of the planet. I really love playing her with my 4 other kreepy squad members. Rushing the enemies core has never been so fun. Overall this game is really fun and helped me deal with my hearthstone addiction I now have enough salt in my daily life that Kripp is not needed. Would play again.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												WALL OF TEXT***********************************************************************************************************Installed it... my eyes started to get tired after a while... So I decide to take a break. Long and behold 7 hours of gaming had past! This game is cocaine on steroids! But... but... but.... but there is a tiny problem gameplay turns stale after a while.You realize you can divide the map into two and force players into awkward entry points that your team has the upper hand.For example: There is a map divided by a bridge-like wooden structure with tons of wooden crates. As soon as the game starts I would go to the part near the trees and make a 2 blocks with hole straight to the water. This makes it harder for tunnelers to simply dig a hole from their base into ours. Next I make a huge hole on top to make sure who ever is above ground has a hard time getting passed and if he does he would have to 1- build his own way into our base or 2- be funneled into our base.So that's it that's how you win that map.Next there is a map with some sort of tower thingy idk hard to describe and another that has both bases separated by 2 bridges.... Both use similar tactics, make a huge hole all the way to the lave (bottom of the map) and defend the cube from above. See where I'm going with this? Once you figure out the best strategy that's pretty much GG.Another map you can dig straight through your base and you find yourself on mid air so you build a bridge that will lead straight to the enemy's base... GG.***********************************************************************************************************TL;DR = Great game but get's stale fast once you figure out the winning strategy but I still think it's a good game.

content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
												This game was great. Was. The new update has turned it in to every single grinding free to play at the top of the steam free to play list. Everybody who played the game prior to the recent update and had any form of character levelling has been reset, you must now pay either in game money, or of course, real money to purchase back your favourite characters, mine personally being the great Tony Turretto, but of course, grinding a game endlessly to make your account stronger with characters, perks and platinum bars is obviously more fun that just simply hopping in to an match with a few friends for a couple of hours and enjoying the game, i do however not have a problem with the game going free to play as more players has always been necessary to this game and of course the more people that play this once amazing and unique game the better, but i find the fact that the freedom of just playing with any character i wanted and the game being balanced so that a new player was on the same statistic level as an experienced player was great, fun and enjoyment was right in front of you as soon as you hit that 'Go' button, but now, a unique game of instant fun and even playstyle has been ruined, and i feel deprived of a great game, which recently, great games have been hard to find. If you love mind numbing grinding for endless hours with little reward other than 'Why don't you pay £6.99 for a booster pack!?' then this game is perfect for you, but if you enjoy hopping in for an hour and having a few fun matches, then sorry but you missed the time for that version of Block N Load.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												I had the opportunity to play this game at RuneFest, a convention for RuneScape which is one of Jagex's most-known achievements in its game history, before it was even mentioned to the public. Right then I knew it would be a fun and casual game and not something that requires too much time.The concept is brilliant and the amount of teamwork needed makes it a great game to play with friends. Alternatively, this also leaves you prone to being teamed up with people who could care less and just do their own thing. Luckily, I haven't experienced the latter and have actually seen a good amount of willingness to teach and help players that are newer to the beta.The only concern I have is that Jagex is going to be charging a price for this game according to the description. If this is the case, this game will fail, just as the several games that Jagex has tried to make before it. There is no way I would pay more than $5 to play this game the way it is. It's too simple and too casual to invest more than that. If you want to gain $$$ then add skins (like you are doing) and possible even characters but try to stay away from pay-to-win mechanics (which unfortunately you are also known for in RuneScape, your most successful game). tl;dr Not worth paying more than $5 for, a fun and casual game, has potential, hopefully Jagex gets it right this time.

												From what I have played of the beta from their website this is a huge improvement over the previous fps i played from Jagex "Ace of Spades". Imagine if you take the previous game, actually have a reason to build due to the build up round, have the classes system from Team Fortress 2 and quite a few block puns. number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												Block N Load has a very steep learning curve so if you want to be really good at the game you are going to have to put some serious time in it... The game is really fun at the beggining tho it can become really frustrating later on if you don't find any friends to play with.There are 3 servers (EU, NA and APAC(Asia - Pacific)) tho only 2 have an active playerbase (EU and NA) for you to play some casual games.Some heroes are easier than others to play and harder to counter if you are really new to the game and it might get a bit frustrating so be carefull, they aren't actually op as you may think.Be patient, make friends and destroy cubes. By doing this you will soon reach the high lvl community and possibly even reaching the god tony status.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
												The devs bit off more than they could chew, ignored community feedback and generally made poor decisions with changes/updates and took way too long to release a map editor, as well as the game just generally having AWFUL performance and being poorly optimized.  Game is grindy and gets old with huge disparity between bad and good players, no real matchmaking to speak of and not enough players even if there was.  Game is dead and they are moving on to another game while claiming "player-driven updates" will keep BnL going.  Well all that says to me is they won't have anybody working on it, and they will occassionally add a player made map to the game.It's free for a few heroes, try it if you'd like, it was a great concept, ruined by incompetent devs, but I don't recommend buying any DLC unless you truly love playing a game with 800 peak players with no real updates or optimizations forthcoming.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2016
												Positives about Block N Load:* Free to play* Custom maps* Quick to learn how to play* Lots of different characters* Nice custom map servers, which players can host.Negatives about Block N Load:* In game perchases which allows you to get other Characters, which are more powerful, so a bit P2W.* You only start with 3 characters.* Friendlys can get rid of all your work in the 5 minute build time. With a bomb....* Custom map building takes ages. ( I dont have 2 hours to make a map, I do have a life. )* Some characters are op as hell, free characters suck.My Opinion of Block N Load:I would give it a go ( It is free ), but dont rage when friendlys get rid of your work.5/10 because of the P2W and op characters

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
												Could be a fun game if it wasn't ruined by EU people playing on NA region causing serious lag. You can't win when the person you are trying to hit is skipping across the map. Also a lot of the weapon effects don't make sense; Take Doc for example, you are damaged from the splash from the Primary weapon, but the gas nades have no effect on you. Most of the weapons have a range on them; but those that really should don't. The Sniper does as much damage from a large distance as he does if the person was right in front of him. The Bazooka for Sarge has no distance restriction or drop so he can basically stand at the other end of the map at take out defences. The Genie has very little ammo, does very little damage, but takes forever to reload. Her "bombs" do no spalsh damage; if it does its very little and random. You might hit right next to the enemies foot and cause no damage, but hit the same spot a 3rd time a cause a tiny speck of damage. There is no balance at all...Only thing this game is good for is to waste time; and if you have a crap computer/laptop since it runs on just about anything made in the last 5 years.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2016
												At first I did enjoy this game. It was fun, balanced and intresting to say the least. As I continued to play this game I noticed quite a few this about this game, one being that it is extremely Pay-to-Win, and here's why;You get next to now credits for playing a game of this. You could say that it's like a game such as leauge, but it's not. Then you could say "do the objectives, those get you credits fast" to of which, don't, this implys that you either grind alot, or take out your dearest friend, Mr.Credit card, and use him to buy your broken characters.This brings me to my second point of how it's pay to win. Normaly in games like this charcters are strong against certian ones. This game takes it to a completely new level of how one character can take out an entire team (These of course being the extremely broken ones). Some can say play the roation, but none of them are generaly the most broken, as the game wants you to buy that charcter. New characters are generally ALOT more broken then the origonal, there is no reason for it, in saying that, as you could piece together, are very expensive.Also the gameplay itself. It took me a while to notice that this game doesn't have ANY aiming animations. The gameplay is alright but what puts the cherry on the cake is indeed the players. Trying to play this game as a team is the same as cutting off a bunch of chicken's heads and telliing them to stack up in a pyrimid, it does not work for many reasons, one of them being becasue the chickens, belive it or not, cannot communicate with you. People on the game seem to not read chat and proceed to do the most silly things, such as enclosing the cube with layers of cubes, you tell them no, yet they continue to do so.Overall I don't recomend this game, I do understand that it is free, but there are far more better games out there that are free. This game has a wonderful concept but. unfortunatly, not deliver.<- THIS IS MY OPINION, TAKE IT OR LEAVE IT, I AIN'T A GOD ->

content:
Posted: October 25, 2015
												This game is FPS. If you are good at other FPS's, you are still nothing in this game.[h] What is this about? [/h]It is about 5vs5 game where you usually want to destroy enemy core cube. There is 3 characters in free rotation, but total of 12 in total to play with in the moment I post this.You can buy characters with either in-game money, which you get from playing game and once-a-day resetting small achivements, such as kill 3 brawn-class heroes or build 3 dynamite blocks. There is also this better money which you can buy with real money, which can be used also for purchasing heroes. Each class also has skins which you can buy with it, but real money makes you no better player than other. Each class is different, and by different I mean by A LOT different. Sniper can only fight seriously from range, ninja brutally murders anyone in melee range and engineer keeps itself alive with turrets. So this game has 12 heroes whose all have this much difference. But each class have blocks, the building is important for all classes. For engineer it is the whole life, but ninja needs ninja nests which he can teleport into with his ability and sniper again can build tiki towers which can work as personal defense, or for greater good, for defending the core. Build, Build, Build.The video in startup of the game tells much. You have to watch it to understand many things in first place, but there is perfect line picked from there:"If you can't get there, go over it. If you can't get over, get under it. "This game is about strategy. You have to plan how to defend, or you will lose. You will know how to counter a defense to win in first place. You need to know how classes work in order to do anything useful with them or even counter them. Killing only slows enemy team, but never stops them from acting.To this all, you need to know how to shoot. It is important, but it only is only partion of total image.In it's finest this game is a strategy game. I would say it to be mix of Minecraft, Team Fortress and League Of The Legends.To make FPS gamers sad,[h]You need to know these to be good[/h]* how to defend* how to counter as many different defenses as possible* teamwork. TEAMWORK.* knowledge of all special blocks* know how to use class* know all the classes by look and voice, it it important* know how to counter any classIf this didn't scare you enough, well, I can't tell how this game works by typing letters here. You must see it.Not recommended for devoted CoD or CS players. Game is too complex. You need more than gun and reflexes.Recommended for Minecraft or Tf2 players. Game shares many core ideas like 3D building and required teamwork.Must-have for ones who would like to see Minecraft, Team Fortress and League Of The Legends together.

content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												Block N Load has a very steep learning curve so if you want to be really good at the game you are going to have to put some serious time in it... The game is really fun at the beggining tho it can become really frustrating later on if you don't find any friends to play with.There are 3 servers (EU, NA and APAC(Asia - Pacific)) tho only 2 have an active playerbase (EU and NA) for you to play some casual games.Some heroes are easier than others to play and harder to counter if you are really new to the game and it might get a bit frustrating so be carefull, they aren't actually op as you may think.Be patient, make friends and destroy cubes. By doing this you will soon reach the high lvl community and possibly even reaching the god tony status.

												The devs bit off more than they could chew, ignored community feedback and generally made poor decisions with changes/updates and took way too long to release a map editor, as well as the game just generally having AWFUL performance and being poorly optimized.  Game is grindy and gets old with huge disparity between bad and good players, no real matchmaking to speak of and not enough players even if there was.  Game is dead and they are moving on to another game while claiming "player-driven updates" will keep BnL going.  Well all that says to me is they won't have anybody working on it, and they will occassionally add a player made map to the game.It's free for a few heroes, try it if you'd like, it was a great concept, ruined by incompetent devs, but I don't recommend buying any DLC unless you truly love playing a game with 800 peak players with no real updates or optimizations forthcoming.

												A really great game, the gameplay is great , it feels balanced and fair, doesnt feel like its play to win.Sadly, the community is not so great...  if you play with friends youre gonna have a really great game , you really have to play like a team because of the building elements, each class and charater has to support each other to be the most effective as each class can be quite different. but if you play the ingame casual youre gonna be lucky if you see someone type anything in the chat once a game or two. most of the time im matched with people that literally dont know what theyre doing, and rarely does someone cooperate. many of the times you play as tony ( an engineer that can build turrets ) people either destroy your turrets ( and it costs you all the bricks you spent on it, you dont get them back for that ) leaving you useless. Other times they just build a bunch of blocks around your base blocks so that the enemies just dig in and hide in there rendering tony useless again.In summary the game is really great and i see great potential in the future,but the community often can ruin your game but we can hope it getts better as the game gets established.and i would like to try the beta competetive ( although the server is online only at designated times making it hard for me to join.(btw im from Europe, yet rarely does someone even understand english in games i join, and sorry for any grammar errors.)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
												I highly recommend this game, very fun. I have yet to have two matches which are the same, so the developers aren’t lying when they say that! Unlike so many other pvp games where the only difference between characters is the stats of the gun they’re using.A unique experience, adding a bunch of insidious traps to your base before the match begins is very creative and enjoyable and also important to victory. This is a game where it is actually necessary to have at least one person camp, so if you like lying in wait, there’s something here for you because few people actually seem to want to do so in the game. The characters have a great deal of variety, from ninjas who can teleport to yetis who call down avalanches to eye-talian construction workers with nailgun shotguns who build turrets you’ll not find a more diverse mix of special abilities and unique building components. There are also characters with a more traditional repertoire such as the Sarge, with his machine gun, rocket launcher and grenades or Cogwheel, a robot with high health and a minigun/cannon arm that builds mortar turrets that he activates with his special that then fire upon the beacon for great damage and lulz. Speaking of lulz, though this game has cartoony graphics the humor is definitely more Adult Swim than Disney. Every character is a true stereotype but not in any sort of offensive way. The one-liners are quite enjoyable and reminiscent of impressions of various cultures around the world, often a strange mix of two. The Mexican ninja comes to mind. There are regularly three characters on rotation that you may use to get gold for unlocking a permanent character, and by leveling up these characters you get bonus gold in large quantities, encouraging trying all of them. You even get the bonus for the free rotation characters as you level them. The maps are varied, featuring everything from symmetric opposing castles to green hilly areas that look similar to the backgrounds in the early levels of Super Mario World or Sonic the Hedgehog. If you don’t like a map, you can always remodel it with explosives to better suit your tastes.  You are able to dig into the various parts of the game world to construct tunnels and hidden alcoves where you may place healing/ammo stations or radars which reveal enemies and their defenses even through walls – very necessary to prevent the aforementioned tunnels from getting into your base and providing the enemy with cover and concealment to attack from. The maps range in size from just one base to destroy all the way up to three. There are even challenge maps which are single player and give a great currency reward simply for completion, with extra but smaller rewards for doing so in a shorter time.There is no pay2win - all characters and abilities are able to be acquired without spending money though as tradition dictates, you may buy premium currency to unlock special skins as well as acquire characters faster, but you may NOT use this currency to buy perks. Perks must be acquired using the f2p currency you get from completing matches and challenges, and are more often side-grades rather than direct upgrades as they always remove one stat to buff another, though higher levels of the perk provide returns typically well worth the cost.As a noob, I found myself able to have plenty of fun. It’s rare to run into a team so well organized that their experience allows them to completely trounce you without you even having a chance. This is in part due to the party system allowing only premades of three out of five in the casual mode, so both teams are bound to have at least one or two experienced players and a noob or two or three ;) . The game is very easy to get into, but the skill ceiling is very high. There are always better and more creative ways to do something, and any character may be used effectively for attack or defense, though some seem to favor one play style over another. The colors are bright, the characters are colorful, and mass destruction abounds! Get this, and support a f2p game that is AAA quality and truly is not pay to win in any way.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												It's a great beta game, could use a lot more optimization. But again, it's in beta so you have to expect it to be under optimized and unbalanced. I usually play as Nigel, the Sniper and I find that his primary weapon (Nellie) is very underpowered. I also feel that the Ninja (O.P. Juan Shinobi) is way too overpowered as it two hit kills (and sometimes one hit KOs) most of the time and is very mobile. So far from what I've observed, the community isn't too nice or educated about the game. Alot of people attack their teammates as they do not know that there is "Friendly Fire" and they destroy their own bases and do not know the actual objective of the game. I feel that the game is poorly optimized (in terms of smoothness and FPS rate) but of course, it is a beta. One thing I hope that does not happen is a pay to play or pay to win game, in which you need to buy the game (although I may buy it - if the game is updated and new content is added that makes me want to constantly play the game) or pay for microtransactions to gain an overpowered ability in the game.All in all, it's a good game but it still needs a lot of updating. I definitely recommend checking it out. Sign up for a beta key on their website - it's free! https://www.blocknload.com/PS: Will update later.

												Most of the time when people talk about the idia a fusing minecraft and a shooter, i just shake my head in disaproval.  people have tried, and most of them have failed. but this game was a pleasent surprise. its a minecraftish shooter that acualy works, and is realativly fun. The microtransactions can be a bit annoying, but if you enjoy the game you can succesfuly grind your way to classes and perks, and the game has a moba style class rotation so that you can still play a variaty of classes. my only complaint is that the game isnt extreamly high activaty so it can take a while to get in to a mach on a bad day.

number of helpful: 37 of 75 people (49%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												In a simple world, this would be a good game however this is not a simple world therefor this game is bad, very bad. This review is coming from the beta however I have participated in many beta's and have not had nearly as many issues as I've had with Block N' Load. So for starters the ping spikes are horrendous, the server constantly spikes from a range of 40 to 600ms during combat. I played on a GTX 970 4GB and an AMD FX-8350 so FPS was not a problem for me, or well it shouldn't have been. Due to the ping spikes, the game ran at an avg of 40 to 80 frames with excessive spikes which caused me headaches. The game itself looks alright I guess, though this is certainly a TF2-Minecraft clone. The stuff that's lacking on the TF2 side of things is proper hit detection for starters, non-split channel team chat, inability to change classes during a game, a very very basic scoreboard, no voice chat, small maps and no satisfaction when winning a game. The game is fun fo about 5 minutes and I'm being generous by giving it 5 minutes because after that it becomes extremely stale, bland and boring. The beta takes up around 2.5GB's and if the full game takes up anymore than that, don't waste the storage space on it. Highly don't recommend this for play ability, I suggest you do play it however so that you can experience the buggy mess for yourself. If the game ever gets a price tag slapped on it, which I believe it will be $30 USD, don't buy this for your own sake. If this were to remain F2P it still wouldn't be worth it because Jagex is surely going to force a P2W model on the game.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												I've only played a few hours of this during the "Free-2-Play" phase, but so far, IT'S AMAZING!!It's an awesome game. It requires teamwork and strategy, as well as smarts to get around. The music is upbeat and gets you pumped up to attack and/or defend. So far the people I've met are pretty awesome as well, so it's a nice community, as far as I know.Though, there are some pet peeves of mine in this game(i.e. not being able to move while in the air), the game is awesome overall. It is, also, a mix between Minecraft and Team Fortress 2. And despite what everyone else says about the price tag, I do agree with it. I'll definitely be buying the game when I get the chance. So much work was obviously put into it and its awesome.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2016
												Do you enjoy 5-man teams that only allow 3-man premades?Do you enjoy getting dicked on by level 173 players that instakill you with perked-out weapons?Do you like playing a defensive character and inevitably getting your base chipped to death because the rest of your moronic team cannot understand the concept of "pushing"?Do you like insanely high character unlock costs that attempt to force you to pay real money to unlock characters, as no sane person would grind 18,950 gold to unlock a single character?Do you like playing in games where the expensive characters have a disgustingly unbalanced skillset that deals massive aoe damage while your terrible shotgun can barely kill a single target with a full magazine?Then Block 'n Load is for you! It's like TF2 and Minecraft made babies, except the community is from Minecraft and the balance of TF2 got thrown to the curb.Enjoy the wide variety of a handful of characters, only 3 of which are ever actually playable unless you grind yourself into a coma and spend the gold to unlock a single additional character.Do you like balanced, well made maps? Too bad!Experience CQC ♥♥♥♥fest maps where your only option is to die repeatedly to the 2 enemy ninja players while Eliza instakills everyone on your point by spamming poison grenades that destroy your defenses and erode most of your health. When you aren't playing one of the horribly designed close quarters maps, feel free to experience the wide-open ♥♥♥♥fest maps, where you'll constantly be spammed with rambo rockets and STILL somehow get caught in tons of acid grenades.Features include:--Huge variety of maps, all of which have the same exact meta of "dig a tunnel under their base and constantly zerg rush the cube"--Tiny variety of characters, none of which are balanced. The cheapest characters are stupidly underpowered and the most expensive characters can take on 2-3 lower cost characters simultaneously--Terrible destruction and climbing physics, which generally results in the map being an un-navigable, overly frustrating hellscape of potholes and deathfalls.And so much more!

content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												What I liked about the game were classes, ability to customize your loadout and destructable terrain. It plays like normal fps except you can dig under them, jump over them and set all sorts of traps for enemy team.  Gameplay for the most part is good but there are some bugbears for me. Matches can drag on and being on a losing team for 45 minutes because people refuse to surrender can become a massive chore if you're only one on your team who is not turtling. So your enjoyment of the game is reliant on the team you play with. Playing with random teammates at worst can be a massive chore, since it's really hard to get anything done by yourself especially considering you need to be point blank range to actually do proper damage to the core, and good luck with that if all your team does is turtle.On the technical standpoint I didn't see any massively glaring problems and fps stayed good at all times, Characters speaking same one liners all the time does get annoying and frequency should be cut to half.I feel another thing that might put off people from the game is the pricepoint, I myself got it with 33% discount but I'm not sure I would have paid the full price at 27 euros.Overall a decent game with some annoying flaws from what I played. Might be too expensive at full price point.
