content:
Posted: December 21, 2016
												The game is a 4/10, and here are the reasons:1. Its Pay2Win, you can buy every hero in the game with real money, and the problem is, most of the times you will need to do that, because the hero's price with normal money is so incredibly high that you will need to play a huuuuge amount of time to get one.2. The Community is Sh#t. And yes I mean  Sh#t	 there are only little kids playing the game and in Europe there are only kids from arabia, or Turkey, and there is nothing wrong with that, the problem is they cant speak english most of the times so you cant really play with them as the game is teambased.3. The Winning&Losing System is a pile of  Horsesh#t	 when you win you get a good (still really low) amount of money, depending on your performance about 100-500 bars (500 if you are really good) and when you loose about 20-120 and nothing can help you here, you supported your team? We don't care, you lost. You killed a ton of players? We don't care you lost. 4. It's really unbalanced, there is the Ninja, which is a REALLY annoying class, and he can do a ton of damage, and he doesn't even cost much. So all the little kids use him to defeat you, especially if you play support you will die from him as he can just teleport away and leave a bomb. And if you play Support/Builder you will not gain anything as you get money mostly from killing.5. You can't really play the game in the evening, or at any time really as there are nearly no official games, and if you join an unofficial game it will most likely end up in spawncamping.The Game itself is good, but the community is really bad, so if you want to play a good game thats like this maybe try Ace of Spades, its probably better.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2016
												Block N Load is a team based PVP shooter game with building blocks added for base defence. It worked, looked ok, sounded ok, played ok.  Has a tutorial map and video. Has free heroes in rotation. You can earn some currency to buy heroes and perks.  Creative block building and mining can help in defence and offence. Maps have a destructible environment so you can tunnel your way to the enemy base. Has support class heroes. Some heroes are disadvantaged to certain game roles and experienced player will have permanent bonuses. Matches are rather long. Try it if you like games like team fortress 2 and minecraft.For more info:

content:
Posted: May 11, 2015
												A minecraft and TF2 knockoff, but probably one of the best knockoffs I've played in a long time.The game blends building and destruction from Minecraft with the modern weapons, graphical style, and gunplay of TF2.  Add on some strategy for the icing on the cake, and you've got Block n' Load.The game stays true to the "No game's the same" line, as every time the teams are different, and thusly the strategies change from map to map and team to team.  One time, I played against a five-player team made entirely of Cogwheels.  Other times, the teams can be perfectly balanced and equally matched to the point of one destroying the other's cube as they watch their own cube blowing up.  We BOTH lost!The controls and climbing can and probably will feel clunky to dedicated FPS players, as they're a bit odd.  Optimization COULD use some work, but it was made with Unity, which is not brilliant for optimization.All in all, I would recommend for anyone who wants something a little different in the FPS department.Tony and Nigel FTW!(Sidenote: This is my first Jagex game, I cannot really give a yay or nay about them since I haven't been around for them ruining Ace of Spades and other stuff I hear them getting ragged on about.)

content:
Posted: October 9, 2015
												I found that in the matches I played the same tactic always was used. Tunnel down at the start, tunnel from your side to their side, and come up under their feet. Whoever manages the feat first, most likely wins the round. The radar stations aren't large enough in radius to cover enough area leaving blindspots. The matches were hide & seak, until one got below the base. Then it devolves into a brawl. Two games failed because my own teammates sabotaged the game by destroying defenses and creating access for the enemy.Further detriment is the fact that you are stuck with whatever loadout your character has. Once you get to level 6 with a character you can diversify a little, with the additional options that character has, but you are restricted in which blocks you can use by your character. You better like the blocks and weapons of your character, because you are stuck with them. Guy is melee? He always will be, no choice. Guy has no radar? Never will have.Wish I could say I had an enjoyable time, but the matches were filled with toxic players and trolling and the lack of freedom and weapon selections, with no real influence on the loadout, just makes me suggest to avoid this game.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 11, 2015
												A minecraft and TF2 knockoff, but probably one of the best knockoffs I've played in a long time.The game blends building and destruction from Minecraft with the modern weapons, graphical style, and gunplay of TF2.  Add on some strategy for the icing on the cake, and you've got Block n' Load.The game stays true to the "No game's the same" line, as every time the teams are different, and thusly the strategies change from map to map and team to team.  One time, I played against a five-player team made entirely of Cogwheels.  Other times, the teams can be perfectly balanced and equally matched to the point of one destroying the other's cube as they watch their own cube blowing up.  We BOTH lost!The controls and climbing can and probably will feel clunky to dedicated FPS players, as they're a bit odd.  Optimization COULD use some work, but it was made with Unity, which is not brilliant for optimization.All in all, I would recommend for anyone who wants something a little different in the FPS department.Tony and Nigel FTW!(Sidenote: This is my first Jagex game, I cannot really give a yay or nay about them since I haven't been around for them ruining Ace of Spades and other stuff I hear them getting ragged on about.)

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
												Decided to play this, and I will say it does have some competence.Too bad the ♥♥♥♥ing devs couldn't use that to do anything but wipe their asses with it.This game forces SOOOOO much stuff down your throat. It will force you to either:A.) Not have fun,B.) Lose every game,or C.) Pay some money to completely ♥♥♥♥ your progression.This game is about teamwork (to an extent), if you want to defend your base correctly, you'll have to have a man who can place turrets (Tony). If you want to attack the enemy base correctly, you'll need a man who can charge in there willy-nilly (Everyone else). Tony is so weak it's pathetic, his turrets have the worst targeting I've seen to date, with enemies just able to run past their FOV and only lose 20-30 health. And Tony's shotgun takes about 3 reloads to kill a single unit. Now maybe I'm just nit-picking, but let's see what else the game does wrong.When you watch the tutorial video, you are given 1500 "Gold", which is a free currency obtained from playing games/completing challenges. When you play and finish your first game, you're given another 1500 gold. Now that you have 3000 gold, you think "Hey, that's quite a lot, maybe I can pick myself up a new character because I don't like the starter ones?" and then you go to the shop, click the "Hero" tab and see that the cheapest heroes available are 6000 gold. Now you're probably thinking, "Oh, well if that's the case, I should have them in a couple games, right?" Wrong. In experience, I only get about 50 gold for losing, 75~ gold for winning. Challenges, some of which are hard as hell, give you about 300 gold. This model is so ♥♥♥♥ing cheap that it's a scam at that point. Now maybe you're willing to cough up some real life currency to aqcuire a character you REALLY want? That'll set you back about 5 American for a single hero. In conclusion, this game will force too much down your throat and reward you with very little if you suck it up. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY NOR YOUR TIME. tl;dr: This game sucks.

Now I'm being stuck in games where the teammates don't know how to fire their gun or stare at bricks all game. Meanwhile, the enemy team is some three-stack clan that knows the ins, outs, and arounds of every map, every character, every tactic while also spewing at you with toxic and salt-ridden messages.The devs are slow, add useless updates, and don't revamp crucial game mechanics that need it, This game is, pardon my language, a ♥♥♥♥♥how.You'd be better off playing Dota 2.

Posted: March 17, 2016
												I downloaded this game to play with my seven year old. He liked it, mostly because of the goofy voices and characters. However, even he could tell after an hour of play that it was pay to win shovel ware. Sweep this one under a 1x1 tile and forget it ever existed.Just have to add a comment to fellow reviewers. If in your postive critique of this game you mention it is not pay to win and then mention unbalanced character classes you obvioulsy live in a trumptastic world of delusion. If a character is OP, and is purchasable, even if it can be aquired via gameplay it is pay to win. Especially if obtaining that character takes dozens of hours of play. That is the definition of free to play. The lack of balance is intentional as well as the absurd time to unlock without paying all designed to force you to pay. Use some common sense.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26
												Pro's:-Unique gameplay, a first person shooter in a mostly destructible environment.-There is community made maps along with custom lobbies.Con's:-Characters mostly consist of stereotypes with some going a little too far in my opinion.-Game is poorly optimized-Characters are poorly balanced-All characters are locked but there is a free rotation of 1 character per class every week I believe, however only some of the characters cost a fair amount while it could take weeks to unlock others. The higher priced characters are unjustified as they're not better or could even be worse than cheaper ones.-Each character has an obscenely large amount of voice lines that activate at random times which could give away your location and can get bothersome quickly. While you can mute this feature on your end, everyone else can still hear it.-There are custom skins available for the characters, but they're not available to free to play users.I would not recommend this game, there are likely better alternatives. The developer also appears to have abandoned it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												Great execution of the "shooter-block" genre, all the controls of the guns feel snappy and effective. Aside from a few strange setups I've seen, most teams are pretty vigilant about at least attempting to defend thier core's which leads to some decent strategic framework to build on. Once the main group of players get ranked and get the hang of it I'm sure this will change and there will be less random building and more stragety once people know where to place blocks etc.All in all it has great promise, lets hope they can keep the playerbase attracted with new maps (hopefully playermade will be added) and keep the classes properly balanced. Buy it and you'll have yourself a great timesink for the foreseeable future.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
												Block N Load------------------------------------------------------Once apon a time there was a gamer. This gamer was really intrested in FPS games, epecially free ones. He noticed a strange looking game on the store, and he decided to get it. This game was called Block N Load and really did look great. He won a few games, he lost a few, and he really enjoyed the game. The physics were a bit wonky, and there were many annoying scrubs. But he still liked the fast-paced action. A few days after, he decided to play again. But something was... different, the game kept kicking him, it lagged a lot, and it was just generally broken. He decided to try to join one last game, without any lag or getting kicked out for "no connection". (sarcasm intended of course) He accepted the "join game thingy" and then the game said he is blocked for a few hours because of not accepting "many games". The gamer raged, and decided not to play it untill the next update, or for a few weeks. And this gamer, is still raged writing this review.The gamer would've recommend the game,but now, he doesn't know what to say about it.You know what? Screw it, I'll just recommend itbecause I really liked it.~ MagikalMystery

content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												I've been a major supporter of Jagex for about 10 years now, and when I heard about this game, I figured I'd give it a shot while it was free to try for 3 days after release.I was worried it may have ended up a Minecraft ripoff, but I was pleasantly surprised. Block N Load takes 2 ideas that have already been done (Minecraft and Team Fortress 2) but mixes them in a beautiful symphony of game design, creating its own original style that I've never seen done before, with replayability beyond my initial expectations.It truly is a different experience every game, primarily in part due to the near unlimited potential to destroy and build.Unlike Minecraft, you won't be able to build in bliss, you're always under pressure. In the preparation phase, you only have so long, and need to hurry. In the actual battle, you won't even have that luxury, you'll be building walls, placing bombs, and even establishing a forward base as bullets fly overhead and artillery is tearing apart the world around you, and you'll never know whether or not someone might sneak up on you while you're building and knock your block off (pun intended).As soon as the game's free to play time was up, I immediately purchased it and haven't looked back.The only major problem with the game I've encountered is the fact that my account is level 90 (currently the level cap) and can still get paired with four level 0s, which means certain defeat for your team no matter how good you are. This could be easily fixed by only pairing people of similar skill levels, though the exact method would be up to Jagex.Unlike what many others have said, I have to disagree with the opinions on the overall community. Though there are plenty people who take me back to my Modern Warfare days, it's pretty tolerable, and not TOO common for me to make any major complaints. It could use some improvement, but so long as you're not too thin-skinned, you should be fine for the most part.I'd highly recommend this game to most everyone, and will continue to play, myself.

content:

												Great execution of the "shooter-block" genre, all the controls of the guns feel snappy and effective. Aside from a few strange setups I've seen, most teams are pretty vigilant about at least attempting to defend thier core's which leads to some decent strategic framework to build on. Once the main group of players get ranked and get the hang of it I'm sure this will change and there will be less random building and more stragety once people know where to place blocks etc.All in all it has great promise, lets hope they can keep the playerbase attracted with new maps (hopefully playermade will be added) and keep the classes properly balanced. Buy it and you'll have yourself a great timesink for the foreseeable future.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												Now before you go judging this game by its vector style graphics and shouting the forbidden word (Minecraft) take a look at what the game is trying to offer. This game is nothing like minecraft, sure it has the cube like style and ability to build but it is done in a unique way. You start off on one side of a symmetrical map, your primary objective is to build defences around your various "cores", after the pre-round timer has reached zero the wall in-between you and your foes will disappear, allowing you to attack them and them to attack you. This is where the games first person shooter / MOBA style combat is introduced, fighting off against the opposing team in an aim to destroy their base and simultaneously defend your own. This game is tonnes of fun and best played with a couple of friends. Although it is not without its downsides, for example how repetitive the gameplay can get or the limited range of classes available, but that being said this is in early access and you should not let these factors deter you from playing it. We can only hope that the developers continue this great work with the players in mind and listen to what we have to say.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2015
												Imagine a crappy TF2 with the worst "building" mechanics you've ever seen. That is this game in a nutshell. Almost all of the classes are worthless and the mechanics are worthless, except Ninja who can kill anyone else in ~3 seconds. Everyone except Ninja does moderate to low damage (even the turrets are like squirt guns).You can also build throughout the entire match which makes this less strategic and more spam than anything. The combat itself is also lackluster and laggers have an advantage. All in all, this game plays and feels like a crappy clone of a f2p Minecraft style gun game that I cannot remember the name of.All playing this game did was make me remember how awesome Team Fortress 2 is and to download it after uninstalling this.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2015
												Just a heads up, I played in the Beta  and it was so much better in the beta than it is now ProsUnqie heros: all the heros are really fun to play, and none of them are copys of echotherUnqie Game: You don't see many Build n Shoot games, and if you do most of them don't last that longGood Teacher: Block N Load does an amazing job at teaching you what it can, but not so much as to overwhelm youEasy to play: This game doesn't have weird gameplay strats that makes it hard to learn, its simple, and strait to the pointCustomisation: you can customize the blocks your Hero uses so you can defend/attack differentlyFast matchmaking: The match making in this game is verry verry fast, sometimes you can even get a match as soon as you press the play buttonCons:F2P: Its a Free To Play game, so of course you have to expect some sort of way for them to earn money"Gold" locked hero: Since its F2P all the heros are locked by default and they have a free rotation, and when you complete a match, you get gold, if you win you get more gold, this wouldn't be a problem, but heros range from 3k gold, to 13k gold and I get 75 gold every win, this is not counting the daily/level up bonues.Locked block changing: You can customize your blocks, but you need to play a lot and get your account to level 6 before you can do so, this is quite bad, cause not only it is a gimic to get people to play more and more, and they do it by locking of a core mechanic of the game and this is not something a game should have to result to doing.Bad matchmaking: the matchmaking may be fast, but its so bad, its something to laugh at, 1/6 are acutaly fun to play (this doesn't mean a win, even losses can be fun sometimes).un-even matchmaking: the problem with matchmaking being bad is the fact that even though its your 1st or 2nd game ever, you could be matched aginst someone who has a hero that costs 13k gold, or is lvl 6 with their account so they can use blocks you can't, giving them an advantageArt Style: the comicy/childish style of the game is its bigest downside, its atracts childred, making playing the game quite hard because their young minds arn't quite as develped as olderminds, resulting in slower reaction time, and poor judgment.Stupid players: I'm not going to be blunt with this one, its true, even the tho game tries so hard to teach its new players how to play the game, there are always people who will not take the time to watch a 3 to 5 minute video, so almost every match at least one of your allys is either a child or an idoit, so they destory your defences because they think theirs are better, or they are just trolling, or sometimes people don't know how to recall to base (b button), so to get out of a pit they desotry half the pit just trying to get out, or people don't take a few seconds to read a summary of what their hero does, meaning the wound up fumbling about only building basic blocks and shooting with left click.un-balanced heros: some of the heros are just either overpowed, or underpowerd, someone with a minigun can do 20dmg pershot (body shot), while someone with a siper can do 40 dmg per shot (body shot) TL;DR Block N Load used to be a great game, but then it went F2P and in doing so added F2P gimics, making the game grindy, not fun for new players, and hard to find good team mates that don't troll Score I rate this game 4.5/10Its a great game, it can be fun, its a uniqe game with uniqe heros,But its hard to have fun, it has tomany gimics to get people to spend money or play moreand one of its gimics locks of a core mechanic of the game, and the matchmaking makes it even worse for new players, and on top of that half of players don't take the time to learn the game, they just jump in, not knowing how to play or what to do.so the reason for my score is cause it was a fun game, but it going Free to Play forced the Devs into adding gimics that took away more than half the fun, and making the Cons out weigh the Pros please excuse any typos or grammar errors I am dyslexic

content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
												Block N Load------------------------------------------------------Once apon a time there was a gamer. This gamer was really intrested in FPS games, epecially free ones. He noticed a strange looking game on the store, and he decided to get it. This game was called Block N Load and really did look great. He won a few games, he lost a few, and he really enjoyed the game. The physics were a bit wonky, and there were many annoying scrubs. But he still liked the fast-paced action. A few days after, he decided to play again. But something was... different, the game kept kicking him, it lagged a lot, and it was just generally broken. He decided to try to join one last game, without any lag or getting kicked out for "no connection". (sarcasm intended of course) He accepted the "join game thingy" and then the game said he is blocked for a few hours because of not accepting "many games". The gamer raged, and decided not to play it untill the next update, or for a few weeks. And this gamer, is still raged writing this review.The gamer would've recommend the game,but now, he doesn't know what to say about it.You know what? Screw it, I'll just recommend itbecause I really liked it.~ MagikalMystery

content:
Posted: December 9, 2015
												Just a heads up, I played in the Beta  and it was so much better in the beta than it is now ProsUnqie heros: all the heros are really fun to play, and none of them are copys of echotherUnqie Game: You don't see many Build n Shoot games, and if you do most of them don't last that longGood Teacher: Block N Load does an amazing job at teaching you what it can, but not so much as to overwhelm youEasy to play: This game doesn't have weird gameplay strats that makes it hard to learn, its simple, and strait to the pointCustomisation: you can customize the blocks your Hero uses so you can defend/attack differentlyFast matchmaking: The match making in this game is verry verry fast, sometimes you can even get a match as soon as you press the play buttonCons:F2P: Its a Free To Play game, so of course you have to expect some sort of way for them to earn money"Gold" locked hero: Since its F2P all the heros are locked by default and they have a free rotation, and when you complete a match, you get gold, if you win you get more gold, this wouldn't be a problem, but heros range from 3k gold, to 13k gold and I get 75 gold every win, this is not counting the daily/level up bonues.Locked block changing: You can customize your blocks, but you need to play a lot and get your account to level 6 before you can do so, this is quite bad, cause not only it is a gimic to get people to play more and more, and they do it by locking of a core mechanic of the game and this is not something a game should have to result to doing.Bad matchmaking: the matchmaking may be fast, but its so bad, its something to laugh at, 1/6 are acutaly fun to play (this doesn't mean a win, even losses can be fun sometimes).un-even matchmaking: the problem with matchmaking being bad is the fact that even though its your 1st or 2nd game ever, you could be matched aginst someone who has a hero that costs 13k gold, or is lvl 6 with their account so they can use blocks you can't, giving them an advantageArt Style: the comicy/childish style of the game is its bigest downside, its atracts childred, making playing the game quite hard because their young minds arn't quite as develped as olderminds, resulting in slower reaction time, and poor judgment.Stupid players: I'm not going to be blunt with this one, its true, even the tho game tries so hard to teach its new players how to play the game, there are always people who will not take the time to watch a 3 to 5 minute video, so almost every match at least one of your allys is either a child or an idoit, so they destory your defences because they think theirs are better, or they are just trolling, or sometimes people don't know how to recall to base (b button), so to get out of a pit they desotry half the pit just trying to get out, or people don't take a few seconds to read a summary of what their hero does, meaning the wound up fumbling about only building basic blocks and shooting with left click.un-balanced heros: some of the heros are just either overpowed, or underpowerd, someone with a minigun can do 20dmg pershot (body shot), while someone with a siper can do 40 dmg per shot (body shot) TL;DR Block N Load used to be a great game, but then it went F2P and in doing so added F2P gimics, making the game grindy, not fun for new players, and hard to find good team mates that don't troll Score I rate this game 4.5/10Its a great game, it can be fun, its a uniqe game with uniqe heros,But its hard to have fun, it has tomany gimics to get people to spend money or play moreand one of its gimics locks of a core mechanic of the game, and the matchmaking makes it even worse for new players, and on top of that half of players don't take the time to learn the game, they just jump in, not knowing how to play or what to do.so the reason for my score is cause it was a fun game, but it going Free to Play forced the Devs into adding gimics that took away more than half the fun, and making the Cons out weigh the Pros please excuse any typos or grammar errors I am dyslexic

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2015
												People may wonder why I'm reviewing a game I've only got a little more than an hour into. The answer to that is simple. The first part of a game is crucial to the whole experience, and the start of this game didn't impress. The review they proadly wear from PC Gamer says "...it could very well rival TF2 for approachability, quirkiness, and staying power" This may be true, except the approachability isn't there.    When you start the game you only have access to one of 3 different free champions, and they may mostly be advanced or they may be starter. It's all about when you play the game, and this does work with some games. Which brings me to what I think is the source of most of the problems "It worked for League of Legends."    The "Hero" system is basically the same right down to the cycling free champions, but it's not as good because League has better assigned roles that are obvious, and 2 skill based heroes can play very differently from each other. This means that starting out can be more challenging because you're playing with things you don't understand. On a side note to this. Why can't I play the characters that look cool? I'm stuck choosing between Mr. fishbowl-head, a robot, and a pop star. All of this combines to make starting the game hard.    It may be fun to play later on, and I'm sure that high level play is awesome; but in multiplayer games players are content, and I feel like I'm being cheated becaues I want to see if I like the game before shelling out $5 for the champion I thought I'd be able  to play from the start. I know that it would be hard to get people to purchase champions if they were free, but here's an easy solution. Temporary/noob heroes. You could let players who have just started have a few free heroes for the first 5 rounds they play, and then after 5 rounds those heroes are accessed the exact same way they are now, but it would prevent a player from having to either be a boring support hero or being unable to due to choosing a cool hero that relies on advanced tactics.    If this was how the game worked it would get an resounding yes from me for being cool and unique and all the other things it does well, but if it's hard to start then it doesn't matter how good it is because not many people will reach the good part.Side note: People say that it has a good F2P model, but it feels pay2 win to me. In my first game I was dominated by a yeti who pummeled me with infinite snowballs, and I know he either got that hero by.A) Spending money to buy him (and as he had a skin that's what I'm guessing got him that hero)Or.B) Playing the game for a long time. Which makes me wonder why a noob got matched with people who have a lot of experience.

												Game still feels early access.. Some characters are ridiculously op compared to others.The defence aspect of this game is ruined when enemy players can set extremely hard to find respawners next to your base and suicide rush your defences over and over again. (You and your team work together and spend 5 minutes creating an epic impenetrable defence.....one enemy walks in..... Aaaaaaaaaaaand all the blocks are destoried)Another problem with building is that even the most strongest blocks are very weak, this turns the concept of "Build defences and shoot the enemy" to "everyone go full offence and whoever has higher level characters (Cogs) wins"As said before other classes are outright more powerful than others and character to character counter-play is almost non-existant.--------------------------------------------Not worth buying, just buy Minecraft and play defence mods.

content:
Posted: April 18, 2016
												A Awesome Team based game where I get to kill the following:-Mexican Ninja, His ninja-ness AH!-J-pop Singer, She has a thing for cats and Uzis.-A Genie, She likes to call the player "master".-Italian Construction worker, Watch out he'll call his third cousin Luigi.-A Texan Talking Hamster, A Rolling ball of Death.-Creepy Killer clown, Don't worry he'll give you his best punchline literally. -German Steam punk Boxer, You'll love the science, it's pretty sweet. (pun! get it because his name is "sweet science" Funny right? :D)ETCPros: Game is based on teams building, traps, vision, bunkers and defenses.Different characters, with their own unique weapons and abilities each in one of following three roles: Brawn, Skill and Brains.Brawn Classes: Have radars and re spawn pads that help their team with showing where the enemy is and spawning their team mates closer to the enemy's base. Always in the Front of battle.Skill Classes: that require a bit more technique due to how they fight. but have more traps blocks, such as fake blocks (breaks when a enemy steps on making great for hiding traps), Bear traps, and caltrops. Can be in the middle of battle but also can sneakily take out enemies and trigger traps from a safe distance ( All class can too but skill classes have better weapons for triggering.)Brains Classes: are more of a support unit, they can fight but are more in to defending ally bases and supporting, using their Health and ammo crates to hide them all over the map can really change the battle, Also having Force which let allies in but blocks all bullets and enemies. They are mostly in the back defending off invaders but can sometimes push forward.-Good videos are how to play each character. (except Kreepy the clown because he's newest one.)-Steam workshop maps for custom matches. Cons: You have grind a bit to get some characters but missions come daily which give you a good amount of in-game money every day as matches don't give a lot.-Sometimes Players are new to game or just plain don't listen, and makes people get mad as they don't do their roles.-Players who block the cube in, A term which means a team will build a shell your cube (base), sounds like a good plan but allows enemies to have more cover and are able to hide in the shell.Characters have levels that the more you play them they level up and their abilities become stronger, I don't see this as a problem but some people might.Queue time is a slightly a bit long due to a bit of a low player count.Overall I give this game a 8/10, While this is fun its not all perfect, Make sure your PC can run it and please be a good sport to make the community slightly bigger :3Also WHAT THE BLOCK YOUR WAITING FOR?! GET IN HERE AND BLOCK IN!!!p.s Sorry about my grammar.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												Where to start? Well the idea is cool, and that's about it. Little to no community, 2-5 Minute wait times to find a match. The few that are still playing, have such an advantage, its quite pointless for a noob to attempt to start.  All of the characters need a revamp and to be buffed. As the game stands now, I would not recommend it for anyone, unless you want to wait forever, and then play a crappy match. You might not have to spend money on it, but they make it extremely hard for new players to get a grasp on things and or do anything without it. So as I said before, the community, extremely uneven characters, and long a** wait times. Are enough to break this game. Thumbs down for me. This game does have the ability to be a good one, but I feel it needs to goto a company with money and actual time to spend on this!

												This game, good game.Block N Load is one of those kind of F2P games that you kind of wonder what you want to do with it. And guess what? Anything you have to spend real money on is completely optional! This game is real simple. You have minecraft, add a little bit of Team Fortress in it, and BOOM! you have this game!Defend your own bases, and attack the enemy's!+map editor+every character/hero has it's own weapons and abilities.+Immensly fun multiplayer and Time assault.+The world is completely destroyable.-You usually end up with bad people.8.7/10

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												I'm addicted to how fun it is. I lose most of the time, but it's fun.You learn different strategies to do, and the game play isn't a grind. Just played the free version, but I'm getting the game, just because each character has different abilities and play styles. I highly recommend.You may find that people quit when your team starts losing. It's ok, if you're good enough, you might still win. I just have fun playing regardless. btw, mines are awesome, and if tunneling in doesn't work, building a high pathway in the sky that drops in the other person base might. It's a one way ticket in.

content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												Please listen to my review. I understand that many people are upset at Jagex for their past mistakes. Every company is going to make mistakes, some more than others, But the main point here is that we are all human so is Jagex. So of course they are going to have made mistakes. Block N' Load is a revamp of Ace of Spades and it is perfect. It is so much better than Ace of Spades. The graphics are awesome, the gameplay is awesome, and the Devs actually read your posts and reply to them. I know many people complain that the game costs 20$, BUT IT IS SO WORTH IT AND ITS NOT A PAY TO WIN GAME! TL;DR BUY THIS GAME, YOU WONT REGRET IT!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												This game mixes your creative side with your destructive side, and does it in style.I don't recommend running in guns blazing, neither do I recommend camping like that one dude who throws urine at his opponents and slices them up with a Kukri. (seriously, that dude is insane!)If you want to win, you must combine offense with defense, give the enemies pressure while setting up traps and defense to negate some of the pressure that the enemies themselves are giving you. Each hero has a slew of slick tricks and guns in order to keep every other hero on their toes, and if you slip in the slightest; you will regret it dearly. Know when to apply pressure, and retreat to defend against enemy pressure, as this will be an extremely valuable asset to you AND your team on the battlefield.You will see quickly that your pretty N' pristine base that you once thought was indestructible, was quickly destroyed by rockets, mortars, and extreme carnage. Working together in this game is essential, stray away from your team and expect to get blasted by a group and/or whole team of enemies VERY easily. Voice-chat will aid extremely well when working together, and will be similarly good if not better than the teamwork shown within the hero's trailers. Coordination is key!Moral of the Story: You will most likely get your♥♥♥♥♥kicked when you first play, but after the first five matches, you begin to kick♥♥♥♥♥of your own, eventually becoming a very good player and learning the maps, tactics, and strategies in order to win the match(es).So what are you waiting for? GET IN THERE BLOCKHEAD!
